There aren't too many places that that have those little guys in Chicago (well maybe there are a bunch but I only know about Molly's and Sweat Cakes) After a a couple bites I know my fiancé and I needed these for our house warming party. Unfortunately the staff said that mini cupcakes wouldn't keep for more then a day and the house warming party was too days away. Ended up just going with a bunch of assorted normal sized cupcakes. The cupcakes were a huge hit at the party. I think all the cupcakes had this super tasty cream in the middle, wowza! Overall I think they are just as good as Sweat Mandy B's (and fancier lookin) and definitely better then Alliance.

I thought cookies were the new cupcakes. But Molly B wouldn't know. We happened her after a late dinner and they were the only ones open past 11p in Lakeview/Lincoln Park, whch was a surprise.

My partner and I shared four cupcakes this time around: pennington, cake batter, cherry crumble and nutella. They were all rather delicious with varying degrees of sweetness. Do yourself the favor and get a milk. Skim's best because it's that much colder and cuts through the sugar.

The interior is quaint, though it feels as I'm in the middle of someone's move. There were boxes everywhere, making it feel clausterphobic. In all, the four cups and two milks came to $20, as much as dinner. Maybe next time we'll only get two because that's 'spensive! But they're on par with the others we've tried.

Best desserts - hands down! The first time I went, I was expecting a normal cupcake. But really it was love at first bite! I went back and brought friends. While I don't live close by, when I am in the area I will make it a point to stop by! Great place!

I like the environment here. People hanging out, playing board games. I've only tried two cupcakes (blueberry cheesecake and peace cobbler), and I must say it was pretty darn good! But it was like $4 each so I don't know if I can do this everyday.

But my girlfriend has a crazy sweet tooth so...

please please please please please order the peach cobbler cupcake. IT IS THE BEST. I love the cupcakes from Molly's, because they are moist and basically amazing. The decor inside is on point and there are even some board games in the corner of the room next to the door. You will not be disappointed.

Hello!  Yes, another review for Molly's.  I'm so not use to reviewing places with hundreds of reviews, but here it goes.

I was quite surprised, as I really liked their cupcakes.  My husband and I ordered three on an early Sunday morning.  I ordered a strawberry shortcake, he ordered something I can't remember, and we shared a Boston creme. My strawberry shortcake was good, it was pretty standard with a slice of strawberry in the center.  What stood out was the moistness of the cake itself!  Very good cake.   The Boston creme was my favorite, and I'm not even a chocolate fan.  Excellent.  My husband also enjoyed his cupcake.  

These cupcakes were so good, we took a few home with us:  the peach cobbler and the red velvet.  As the descendent of southerners, I had to test out the peach cobbler.  And boy was this awesome!  This was my favorite overall.  The red velvet cake was good, but the frosting was a literal interpretation of creme cheese frosting.  Not so great.  The frosting at Give Me Some Sugah is much, much better.

Criticsms:  The filled cupcakes are expensive.  $3.75 for a strawberry in the center?  Also, this place is very hipsteresque.  As a result, did not enjoy the music.  Maybe its because I think all music after 1999 is utter crap?  

Overall, Molly's has good cupcakes.  Will return and eat them in my car next time.
Yummy! Came all the way from Pennsylvania and were not disappointed.
I had the mixed berry filled cupcake, I thought I died and went to heaven.  I have to try more of these cupcakes!  If other ones taste as good as this one I am sure to become a cupcake monster.

Cupcakes. Flavors. Moist. Fresh. Big. Cute. Awesome. Creamy. High-inducing. guilty pleasure.

That's the abbreviated version. But I'll elaborate on the chocolate one with oreo filling. it's like oreo in a cream form. Just so amazing.
And peach cobbler. Cool and refreshing and rich. yummmay! And I don't even feel sick after inhaling two of these babies.

It gets ridiculously crowded in here, but that just means Molly's does it right!

Been to Molly's several times and I love their cupcakes! They are not too sweet and are moist and decadent. I tried their berry, cookies and cream, peanut butter and many more, and they were all good. I think this place is one of the best in town. Too bad it's not closer...
Best cupcakes I've ever had! I always get the red velvet and cake batter cupcake. I think I've tried every cupcake place in Chicago and nothing comes close to Molly's.
Better than Sprinkles! But not the best cupcakes in the world.

I have traveled all over the US, coast to coast, and hands down this is still the top of my list.  They always have fresh tasting cupcakes, they switch out different flavors all the time, and more importantly its a different level of taste.  

The last time I was there, I got 4 of them: The Mixed Berry is an all-time favorite.  The way they put that filling inside, its bliss.  I have had 4 people who hate cupcakes, like that one.  The Peach, always great when in season.  The Red Velvet, I'll let that one speak for itself.  Last but not least, the Strawberry shortcake.  That was a pleasant surprise.  

The staff is almost always nice there.  There is a bit of a wait, but its worth it.  They put the frosting on fresh sometimes too.

The Decor is nice with the swings on the inside, and a fair amount of places to sit.  They have a GANG of board games, so a nice after place for a date, or a Sunday afternoon with the girls as some might say.

Best of all guys, bring one of these home to your special and she will only but have to smile, and you might get a little more dessert too.

=0

Cute.

The swings used for seats gave this place an extra star. And they're sturdy...

I couldn't decide if we walked into a kid's store or some form of Willy Wonka's cupcake factory.

The chocolate on top of more chocolate cupcake was fantastic!

Yup, cute.
Best cupcakes in the city!  The Ron Bennington is my favorite!  Every visit to chicago includes a stop at Mollys!  She is also in NYC!  Super delish!

These cupcakes are the best. They have never been disappointing. Molly's recently got new signs in their cupcake case and the place looks as adorable and inviting as ever. I definitely recommend it. Ron Bennington is the best. Chocolate Mousse (formerly Chocoloate Decadence) is also amazing and the perfect cupcake when peanut butter is too heavy.

The cupcakes were ok and the chai tea was good. Very busy with customers.  My only complaint would be the fact that they had no sugar free cupcakes for people that have sugar tolerances to monitor. Besides that nice place.

A great weekend dessert place or my ideal spot for a cheat day... my fav 2 cupcakes here are cookie monster, chocochino and chocolate mousse. Perfectly sized moist cupcakes that aren't as gigantic as cupcakes from Crumbs

red velvet went really well with my dark coffee! just go and be happy with the cupcakes you get because everything tastes delicious there!!! The cupcakes are moist, flavorful, and the frostings are heavenly.

The Peach Cobbler cupcake forces me to make the trip from Lincoln Square at least once a month.  However, every single thing I have tried is an absolute delight.

If you are a chocolate fan the Ron Bennington cupcake is heavenly.

If you come to Lincoln Park you MUST stop by Molly's for a dessert.  You will be very happy you did.

The sign is easy for me to miss and I have no idea why.  Just keep your eyes peeled.

Less than one star here. Bought 4 cupcakes to bring home and enjoy, sadly that didn't happen...rock hard edges, no flavor and clearly way overpriced. Cute place, but I'll pass. Very disappointing considering all the rave reviews, clearly from friends and clearly a Yelp paying client. Interesting too that they never reply to any client reviews. We'll see how long your around with this less than stellar product and service.

Love the cupcakes here. My favorite are the birthday batter and the Ron Bennington. These were a great birthday treat for my family. They are very pricey, but worth every dollar for the freshness and quality. Parking is very tough to find in this neighborhood. The only real gripe I have is the seating on the inside is tight. We had to sit at the breakfast bar with a one year old, which was pretty scary.

So the fat guy is reviewing the cupcake store. This will end well.

Molly's Cupcakes, we need to talk. You're so bad for me. You're so good for me. You complete me. I'm not just saying that, either. I know there are other sweets shops around and sure, they're all fun and nice but you're something special.

Let's nevermind your long lines and crowded, cramped dining room. Let's ignore for now your slightly elevated prices and oftentimes scatterbrained counter help that need to hear ones' order a few times before getting it right. Let's even forget the fact that we both know you belong in Lincoln Square, squired away from the teeming throngs of yuppies and trixies and amongst friends in horn-rimmed glasses and ironic t-shirts. Let's overlook all of that, you're beautiful just how you are. For now.

I was privileged enough to have one of the greatest possible creations ever bestowed unto the cupcake community at Molly's Cupcakes: the chocolate, Nutella cupcake. I've written a haiku about it, please enjoy:

Nutella Cupcake
Light and airy piece of lust
Crumbling down my chin

I actually just wrote that now, but you get the idea. Their cupcakes are not cheap, the area can be a bit annoying and parking is next to impossible but I swear to you, it's all worth it. Perfect place for dessert or a midday sweet break. So many cupcakes to choose from and all of them are good, so far as I can tell. I know it's a novelty but who cares, Molly's Cupcakes is good as hell.

I went to Molly's Cupcakes today for the very first time. I went next door to eat at Aloha Eats and noticed Molly's Cupcakes was right next door. I have heard a lot about this place and being the cupcake addict that I am I was very excited to give it a try. I ordered the most popular cupcakes: the Ron Bennington and the cookie monster. I tasted both cupcakes but unfortunately it was not what I expected. The cupcake fillings, which were peanut butter and cookie dough, were a little too much. I would say there was more filling and frosting than actual cupcake, to the extent that it was too sweet that I could not finish it, which is not normal for me, to be honest. As far as pricing, $3.75 I would say is a little too much for a cupcake,  in my opinion. I highly doubt I will come back here again or would even recommend it. In my opinion, Flirty Cupcakes is wayyyy better.

Sure, the cupcake was good, but when on Earth was it ok to charge $4.65 for a teentsy tiny cupcake and a smallish mug of apple cider?  

Criminy.

5 stars for the fun interior, 1 star for the robbery.
Simply put awesome cupcakes. Give them all a try I really liked the Boston creme but i couldn't complain about any of the cupcakes that I tried. Perfect date spot after  a dinner
Simple, delicious, and inexpensive. I had the cream brulé which was very good. Also tried the cookie which was also very yummy :)

Molly's is my number one choice for cupcakes in Chicago. I've been coming since college, and it never disappoints. Even with a line, the staff is friendly and efficient. Love the Cookie Monster, peach cobbler, cake batter, and berry (seasonal) cupcake! Do not miss this place!
Best cupcakes in Chicago hands down!! My favorite is the red velvet with cream cheese!!!

I ordered a dozen cupcakes for my birthday party and they were amazing! The red velvet was especially good...the best I've had in the city.  When I ordered on the phone, they were fast and polite and made sure that they had my order down.  When I came to pick them up, they were very prompt.

Also: I think they have the cheapest dozen of cupcakes in the city (22.00 w/o tax). Not bad!

In the current craze of cupcake shops and cupcake trucks, this is still the best.  Get the Birthday Cake cupcake, with a latte and enjoy! (Because you deserve it after an hour of fighting for parking.)

Hey this place as is a hipster heaven swings for chairs, beautiful servers, vintage lunch boxes, young well dressed clientele, but screw all that the cupcakes are the stars here fresh fluffy moist little bits deliciousness "The Ron Bennington" the star of said stars. So go in push the soft hipsters down and order one today!

We shared a creme brulee and a Nutella peanut butter cupcake between four people. They were the best I've ever had! The cake was more dense than I expected and very moist. It was too sweet which is probably dangerous because I could have eaten so many more! The decorations inspired by the founder's story was cute as well :)

Yummy. Delicious. Fantastic. Nom. Tasty.

Basically, you should try these cupcakes. Or buy me some. :)

Everytime I stop into Chicago, since I am a suburb girl, I HAVE to stop in here. Out of my ways at times, but the PEACH COBBLER is TO D I E For! Another favorite is: Red Velvet.

Was very happy when I saw them on CUPCAKE WARS! lol You rock.

Probably my favorite cupcakes in Chicago.

Super friendly staff, delicious cupcakes, swings?! It's just perfect!

I would suggest the Ron Bennington, the mixed berry, the butterscotch caramel, and the cookie monster. All are amazing. You won't be disappointed.

So grab a cupcake, pull up a chair (or a swing), and play a few rounds of Jenga and Guess Who?!, because this place is awesome.

Also - I rarely buy shirts from restaurants or bakeries, but the logo is so freaking adorable I had to.

Molly's Cupcakes is right down the block from my apartment, which is a blessing and a curse at the same time. Hands down the best cupcakes in Chicago! I'm not big on cake, but Molly's makes me a fan. I highly recommend the Creme Brulee, Red Velvet, and surprisingly Carrot Cake.

My new favorite cupcake place! I visited Molly's after finding out another nearby cupcake place was closed for the holidays. SOO glad I did:)
I shared a peanut butter nutella, Ron Bennington, and a cookie monster cupcake with a friend and they were TO DIE FOR. The cupcakes are incredibly moist topped with cream cheese frosting that will make you want to like your fingers. They also have cupcakes with crumbles of cookies and candies, or you can head to the sprinkle station and pour your heart's desire of assorted sprinkles on your cupcake. The inside of the specialty cupcakes are the best and are filled with ganaches and cremes. They are really rich but do not dry your throat like many others do.
I was really pleased with the interior, as it was both comfy and relaxed. There are board games that customers are free to enjoy and the decorations are seasonal but super cute. Most of all, I loved the relax atmosphere that both the bakery and the workers had. They were friendly and personable, and it was clear to me that they loved their job. Incredible place, will for sure be heading back there soon!

The first time we went to Molly's Cupcakes, the servers behind the counter were friendly and the cupcakes were delicious, a little dry, but I really do think they put crack in the frosting.

So after that first experience, we went back about 30 minutes before closing time for dessert.  I ordered the cupcake and frosting that I wanted and the girl behind the counter informed me that she had already put the stuff away but she guessed that she could drag it out if I really wanted it.  My boyfriend asked about the dessert he had the last time we were there and the guy behind the counter started arguing with him, saying that they never had it and he must be thinking of another place.  Geez, if I wanted a hard time, there are so many other places we could have gone!

The cupcakes were still a little dry but the frosting still tasty.  However, based on the attitude, we won't be back again.

Molly's vegan cupcakes have definitely improved in terms of quality.  The vegan cupcakes are moist now compared to them being dry before, and the frostings are good too.  Although the only downside here is you either get plain vanilla or plain chocolate cake/frosting.  It would be nice if the made interesting vegan options to match the other offerings.

Lincoln Park is such a great place to hang out and it's places like Molly's that make it feel like a homey neighborhood. The cupcakes are delicious --- I recommend getting the full size vs. the mini ones because they are more moist (even though the tiny ones are so cute). The Red Velvet and Carrot are my favorite. Pair it with their cappuccino (they serve Intelligentsia) and you're good to go.

I also love that they stock a few board games in the corner so you can chill and hang out with friends. Scrabble is my favorite...

Also check out the seats at the counter. They're swings that are vaulted into the ceiling and floor --- I swear it'll take you back to the good ole' days of elementary school.

I'm in love with Mike. Okay, so don't tell my boyfriend, but a man who makes cupcakes for a living and who can come up with the brilliant idea of a "Sprinkle Station" ...? LOVE. At first bite, that is.

I recently visited Chicago for a whopping five days, and all five days I noshed some delicious Molly's Cupcakes. I give you, a sampling of these days of orgasmic cakey goodness.

1. The Triple Berry: Hopefully I'm getting the name right, but this cupcake was outstanding. It was a yellow-ish cake with a creamy berry center and purple berry icing and fresh berries on top. The cake was soft, spongy, and absolutely decadent, but not too rich to knock me completely off my feet. It was just enough to, well, get me hooked. If you like fresh berries, this cake's for you.

2. The classic Red Velvet: The test of a good bakery is how they can do up Red Velvet. Luckily, Molly's has this classic cake down. The red velvet was soft and moist, and the frosting was classic and creamy. Thumb's up!

3. The Vegan yellow cake with chocolate frosting: YUM. A vegan cake this good should be outlawed. Better yet, it should be sold as a regular cupcake so people don't know that they're eating something so healthfully delicious. It was uber moist and the frosting was soooo creamy and good. I don't know how they do it, but WOW.

4. The CINNAMON ROLL cupcake: Seriously? A cinnamon roll cupcake? Let me describe how I ate this ... I pealed off the paper, and took layer by layer off the cupcake (yes, it's like a cinnamon roll), swinging it through the creamy frosting on top so that EVERY bite was filled with the delicious frosting. This was better than any regular cinnamon roll I've ever had. CHEERS to you guys. I could eat this for breakfast EVERY day.

The place is adorned with childhood favorites -- board games, swings that you can sit on while enjoying your cupcakes, and even signs on the doors of the bathroom that ring of elementary classroom days. Overall, this place is HOPPING with fun and childhood goodness. Where else in Chicago can you feel THIS much like a kid while also enjoying gourmet, hip-style cupcakes that won't break the bank?

Nowhere. That's where. So go in, say hi to Mike, enjoy a delicious cupcake, and play Connect Four. Oh, and don't forget to chuck some dinosaur shaped sprinkles on that cupcake!

I'm usually not a big fan of cupcake since they are way too sweet. Yet, I absolutely fell in love with the Cream Brûlée cupcake from Molly. Just got a dozen of them for my BFF birthday party and everyone love it.

We ordered 3 cupcakes to try -

Chocolate Mousse - If you are someone who likes regular old devil's food cake and isn't happy with the overly ganached, too sweet, too rich cakes and flourless torte's offered up in place of my favorite devil's food cake, then this is your cupcake.  It looks like the overly ganached version, but it's not.  It's more subtle.  Molly's has done a great job making a chocolate cupcake with layers of flavor and you can eat the whole thing (vs. the ones that after one bite that you can't eat anymore.)

Butterscotch Carmel - By far the best of the three, it melts in your mouth and oh so good.  None of the salty/sweet that's a fad right now.  It's a butterscotch carmel cupcake and it is smoooooooooth.

Cake Batter - Yeh, I know, but I had to try it because I love cake batter ice cream.  All it is is a more cake battery cupcake with a filling.  (Yes, I realize I became Captain Obvious when I wrote that last line)  Not worth the $4.00 for the cake when you have the above two flavors to compare to which are way more sexy.  However, as a cupcake it's moist, just the right amount of frosting, and it's good.  You won't go wrong ordering it at least.

Date night with Mr.Wonderful and a red velvet cupcake with butter cream frosting from Molly's Cupcakes what an awesome way to end the evening.I would have given Molly's five stars with the exception that they don't make any sugarfree desserts :-{
I stopped by Friday and Lord was it packed! The service was fast, though. I grabbed a chocolate mousse  and a vanilla cupcake with brown butter frosting. They were both deelish!

With so much drama in the cupcake scene
It's kind of hard being M-A-double-T
But I, somehow someway
Keep consuming funky ass cakes like every single day

May I kick a little something to the webz and make a few friends
As I eat through 4 dozen cuppies
And my mouth keeps chewing cuz my stomach ain't full

I got peanut butter and frosting getting it on
And they ain't leaving my intestine 'til six in the morning
So whatchu wanna do? Shit, I got a box full of flavors  
And a lot of toilet paper

So turn off the lights and close the doors
But, but what? Closet eating disorder
So we gonna eat a pound of this
Molly's up, Sweet MB's down while you muthabustas feed to this

I'm so glad I came into this cute shop!  The first thing that came to mind was "playtime."  I saw happy adults and children playing Connect 4 by the swing benches, and there's a sprinkle station for build-your-own-cupcakes!  How fun!

Cupcakes here are $3-4, depending on whether they're "filled."  I loved the chocolate decadence (chocolate cake, chocolate ganache filling, and thick chocolate icing).  The vanilla and chocolate cupcakes were okay, and the strawberry shortcake was just too messy and haevy.  I also had the Boson cream one with perfect custard filling.  What I don't like is that the cupcakes are so oily inside, and they crumble rather easily!

OMG! The BEST I have ever had and we have some really good bakeries in LA, including Sprinkles, Sweet Lady Jane, Joan's on Third, and Yummy Cupcakes to name a few.
The cake is very soft and flavor is perfect, not too sweet or too bland.
The frosting is so soft and creamy, unlike some places that just tastes sugary and so artificial.
The price is great too! $2 for a cupcake and $1 for the mini's...yay! =D
Red Velvet with cream cheese icing is my fave.

What a phenomenal place for cupcakes! The location itself is great! It's right around many restaurants and makes for a perfect place for dessert.

The atmosphere is beyond adorable. Colorful tables, cozy corners with soft seats and the awesome swings lined up next to the counter make this place so comfortable and welcoming!

The prices are definitely reasonable. $3.75 for an already made cupcake and $1.00 for a mini "create your own" cupcake and $2.00 for a regular size "create your own" cupcake.

The only caveat I have is related to parking. Since this cozy little hotspot is right on Clark street, parking can be a nightmare! If you're coming from Wrightwood Avenue, turn left onto Clark and there are more street spots open down there.

Happy eating!

I'm shocked that I have never written a review for this place.  We come here every 6 months...right after visiting the dentist!  It's been a ritual for the past 2 years, ever since my little one had his first appointment.

I'm not one to buy into the cupcake fad...a cupcake is a cupcake is a cupcake and you better be damn good to justify the $3.75 price tag.  And even at $2 for a regular...you better be spectacular.   Molly's is the only cupcakes that have met up to my expectations.  I will gladly fork over $3.75 any day of the week for their peach cobbler cupcake.  It is moist, flavorful and to die for.  

I also want to mention that the creativity of the staff is amazing.  I spend as much time looking at the cupcakes as I do the placards that adorn the names and artwork to describe each cupcake.  My little one loves going just for their sprinkle station and games.

My sister had her engagement party amongst girlfriends there and they did a phenomenal job.  They reserved a section for us and were very attentive and accommodating
.

I didn't get the cupcake thing.  I really didn't.  There are so many other types of dessert indulgences out there that seemed more worth pursuing.  Why go for cupcakes when there are airy macarons of many flavors awaiting me?  When there is gelato being made with bacon?  When grapes are being turned into sorbets using some sort of ancient and probably dark magic?

Well, as the kids out on the interwebz say, Molly's pwned me and made me sound like a stoopid noob (or is it newb, I'm never sure of the lingo).  

I don't know who Ron Bennington is, but I'm sure it is just another name for God, like YHWH or Jesus or Chuck Norris.  That thing was just plain ridiculous.  Chocolate cake was moist, peanut butter filling not overpowering, and the chocolate ganache with crushed butterscotch topping was an excellent topping.

The Cookie Monster fulfilled all of my dreams of combining cupcake eating with the unholy pastime of eating raw cookie dough.  For this I say thank you Molly.

I still don't know that I get the whole cupcake thing.  But I definitely get Molly's Cupcakes.  And I want to get them again ASAP!

3 Words: Cake Batter Cupcake
You will need a moment of silence when you get to the middle....
I think I have had every brand of cupcake in Chicago and Molly's beats them all.  I ordered two dozen of the mini ones for my friends baby shower and they were a hit.  The original Molly's (chocolate with vanilla frosting-not the buttercream) is also beyond words.

This place makes the fat boy inside of me jump (or whatever his equivalent would be) for joy!! Decor is nice, and the friendly service is top notch.  I only have 3 words: CAKE.BATTER.CUPCAKE.

The.end

5

Crestfallen.  Okay, well, maybe that's a bit dramatic.  How about swing fallen?  They have a swing in Molly's, and I think I've fallen off of it after sampling a few of their cupcakes.

First of all, I will give Molly's credit where credit is due.  I hate using this word, but the space is "cute."  If you're of the female persuasion, your senses are going to go haywire when you cross the threshold into Molly's because everything is just so darned cute.  There's a reason every cupcake joint in the city is done up in pastel.  The only thing remarkable about the space to me, as a guy, is that it's certainly more welcoming and inviting than a certain cupcake and confectionary emporium I'll mention later.

The other two things I give Molly's credit for is that they sell the regular cupcakes for two dollars each and that they carry Intelligentsia, as seems to be the case with the big name cupcake houses.  Molly's is on par so far.  

But what really matters when you get down to brass tacks about cupcake joints is first and foremost the cupcakes.  If you're going to have "cupcake" in your business' moniker, then your cupcakes better be tip top.  So I presented to Molly's under that assumption as well as keeping in mind the hundreds of reviews touting it on Yelp.

I'm not much for being blatantly ripped off, so I avoided the $3.75 per cupcake specialty and filled cupcakes.  I wasn't born yesterday, pal.  I mean honey.  I'm not paying an 87 percent markup for filling or a cookie on top.  

I ordered one vanilla on vanilla and one red velvet with the creamed cheese based icing.  The cake on both cupcakes was moist.  The vanilla cake tasted much better than the red velvet, which just fell flat and had no bite to it.  The icing was the real story.  The vanilla icing was of the whipped variety.  It tasted like whipped butter with a little powdered sugar for coloring.  Where's the sweetness?  What a huge disappointment.  Worse yet was the creamed cheese icing on the red velvet.  I believe what it was was pure, whipped creamed cheese with no other ingredients added.  I'm sure I'm probably wrong, but the bottom line is where's the sweetness?  Did they run out of sugar on this day at Molly's?  This is where I fell off the swing.  Icing to me is thick, sweet and applied by spatula.  Maybe I'm old school.

I'm sorry Molly, but the reigning Cupcake Queen will rightfully retain her crown.  Sweet Mandy's B's retains the throne in a landslide.  It's not even close.  

It pains me to do this, but everything is relative.  Consequently, Molly, you're only two stars.  Sorry.

I'm not a fan of red velvet so whenever I visit little cupcakeries like this, I don't even bother.  But hel-lo, Cookie Monster.  And Mixed Berry, you were surprisingly tasty for seeming like such a boring little thing.

I know I'm supposed to feel like I'm betraying my west coast roots when I give this place 5 stars (I'm from Southern California, after all -- the birthplace of the cupcake craze thanks to Sprinkles), but I can't help it.  I'm back at my sunny, seaside hometown but I still miss my trips to Molly's, even if it meant walking through the snow to get there.

I was SUPER excited to try Molly's because of the rave reviews. I was utterly disappointed. I tried the peach and pumpkin cupcake and both were just ok. The pumpkin was too dense and dry for me.

First of all, why are the cupcakes stored in the refrigerator? I dislike cold baked goods, it completely ruins the entire consistency of the cake.

Second, the "add your own sprinkles" section is located literally on top of the garbage can. Thats gross.

Third, I was looking forward to sit on the swings in a cute cupcake shop eating my cupcake like a Disney movie but I was disappointed to see that "cute" was the last adjective I would use to describe the place. More like "cluttered" and "cramped."

The only reason why I give this place 3 stars is because I got to see cute puppies at Pocket Puppies on my way there.

I'm not the biggest fan of cupcakes, but I like Molly's over many other cupcake places I've had, mainly because it's not as sweet. Me and the cousins got there around 9 or so on a Wed night, and only waited 5 minutes or so, even though the place was still fairly packed.
Cranberry Orange: One of their winter specials, it has quite a strong orange taste baked with chocolate frosting in reminiscent of those Chocolate Oranges. They did have cranberry baked into the cake part, although it didn't contribute as much to the taste.

Ron Bennington: We got this because they did not have the Peanut Butter Nutella one of my cousins was looking forward to. Turned out to be very good, like a tribute to Reeses Peanut Butter Cups.

Cookies and Cream: Fairly self-explanatory, just what you would expect in cookies in cream, although like the other two cupcakes was not overly sweet like many cupcake joints are.
Again, not the best judge of cupcakes here, but just my perspective as a guy who prefers savory over sweet.

P.S. Like all the other reviewers have noted, you gotta love the energy in place with the 90's hits blasting and groups playing connect 4 & taboo at the tables!

I honestly can't review the quality of their cupcakes, because my experience was unique. I went home to Chicago for one week during the holidays, and on Boxing Day I begged my friends to take me to Molly's. Unfortunately, the store was closed when we got there. However, someone was taking inventory in the back and noticed us standing outside miserably. He took pity on us and let us in. We noticed there were a few cupcakes left in the display stand and asked if we could buy one of those. He was understandably reluctant to give them to us at first, since they'd been sitting out for two days, but they were refrigerated so we figured there wasn't much of a risk. He finally caved and gave us a cupcake each, so thank you, mysterious inventory counter!

I got the Oreo cupcake and loved it even though it was a little old. The frosting was sweet but light, and the chocolate cake was rich and moist. I'll definitely go back for another one, but this time I'll make sure to go when they're open.

Right after devouring our cupcakes, a huge wave of despair washed over us. We  realized that we would never taste such great cupcakes again. At least, not until we visit again.

With over a thousand reviews, I'll keep it short and sweet...

The interior of this place is so whimsical. I envy Chicagoans these types of venues full of delicious food and cute decor. If you can, definitely sit in the swing seats.

I LOVE sprinkles and them having a station to add MORE of these awesome bits of color was so much fun! Although, no matter how many sprinkles I added, the sadness of living so far away from Molly's will never be requited!

If you're coming here for the cupcakes, do yourself a favor and get some of the center-filled ones. Our favorites were 1st place: Butterscotch Caramel and a close second to Kahlua. At around 3$ a pop, we couldn't try many flavors. But really, all of them were great; super moist and thoughtful flavor pairings.

Why I Dig Molly's:
-Cool, unique vibe
-Lots of rooms to chill and eat your delicious cupcakes
-Yummy Intelligentsia Coffee
-Extra sprinkles at the customization bar
-The bathroom doors look like classroom doors
-The staff is artsy and cute
-Yummy flavors that are fun to try (the Strawberry Shortcake is amazing)

Overall I love going to Molly's. My boyfriend and I make it a special occasion when we visit and we take our cupcakes home, usually to enjoy for breakfast the next day.

The only downside for me is that a cupcake costs $4. This is a little expensive, but I understand the effort that goes into making them so delicious (definitely better than Cupcake, Lovely, Sweet Mandy B's and Alliance).

The cost makes getting a Molly's cupcake a special event, which I suppose makes the cupcakes even more special themselves.

A very fun atmosphere with some funky decor.  It's a nice place to come on a warm evening to have a cupcake with friends, family, or a date.  My husband and I got the Ron Bennington and a blueberry cheesecake cupcake to split.  I thought the blueberry cheesecake one was a little underwhelming, but the Ron Bennington (chocolate cupcake filled with peanut butter filling and topped with butterfingers) was definitely a hit.  I would definitely go back for that one.  Each cupcake is about $4, so it's not a place you wanna go to get cupcakes for your kid's class (unless you have a bigger cupcake budget than I do), but it's decently affordable for an occasional dessert outing.  The variety is nice, so there's a lot you can choose from at all times.

Pricey. Overall I think majority of these cupcake places are over priced and overrated!

However, Molly's is significantly better than sprinkles's cupcakes. They were much more moist and flavorful.

In comparison to Crumbs, they are about the same (until I try more from each place).

Key lime cupcake: very good

Most popular cupcake according to their staff (forgot the name): didn't like it. It was just too much going on and I felt like I was eating peanut butter from the jar.

If you want them individually boxed they charge extra after a certain number of cupcakes, that is a little ridiculous.

If I come back I may try the minis because those actually looked like they were worth trying.

Staff was nice. Seating area is a little congested.

Molly's... I hate to compare such a nice quaint shop with a chain cupcake shop - but Gigi's (which I've had in Memphis) blows this place out of the water on presentation and taste.

We only had 2 cupcakes here, The Cookie Monster (vanilla cupcake, stuffed with cookie dough, topped w/ buttercream & a cookie) and the Boston Creme (chocolate cupcake, stuffed with Boston Creme, and topped w/ fudge) - both were decent - but overpoweringly sweet! The cupcake itself reminded me of a muffin consistency and was rather heavy vs. light and airy. Maybe I just need to try a greater variety of Molly's confections to really make a fair judgement.

The actual shop was cute - they have a sprinkle bar and part of the bar seating area is SWINGS (super cute idea)! It was a tiny place with not a whole lot of seating so we were crammed in while in line next to people at the tables and a couple of older folks pushing past to get to the lavatory. Once we paid we realized there was no where to sit, so we went outside, cracked open the box, hopped on a bus, & ate up both of our cupcakes.

All in all I'd say Molly's is probably a LOT of people's fave place... me, not so much. I do love the idea and with all the amazing pictures and reviews I read before my visit, I think my expectations were just too high.

I will give Molly's another shot when we return to Chicago and hopefully I will be blown away by the deliciousness in the Windy City.

I haven't been here in years!! I used to get these cupcakes all the time but this trip was the first time I had it fresh and MAN what a difference! Me and my bf shared a coconut cupcake. So delicious!! I wanted to lick the plate and order 3 more because everything looked amazing. Too bad we were too full from Del Seoul. We will def be back!!

I have enjoyed each trip here. It was a complete zoo of people each time except for one, and that time it was really enjoyable. We got a nice table and played some Connect-Four (they had a few games sitting out).

The staff is always extremely pleasant, which is all the more impressive, considering how busy and how much of a hectic environment it can be at times.

The decor is a bit out there, but there are some momentos hanging on the wall that tell a story. The bar area has swings as well. It is a bit cramped, especially with the crowd that it draws...

The food itself is delicious. It is definitely an occasional treat for me; I don't know how other places compare with the pricing; the cupcakes add up but are wonderful. My favorite is the red velvet. The other food is good, too. I have enjoyed a latte and 7-layer bar. I don't know that it's the best around, but it's great, and in a wonderful neighborhood.

Their cupcake selection is very good - They also serve intelligentsia coffee, but they don't do anything fancy (no pour overs or French press). The interior is cute but max 20-30 seats. Swings in front of the coffee counter!

Current Faves: Creme Brûlée cupcake

Ok to Try: Ron Bennington, Red Velvet, Boston Cream

We had Molly's do the cupcakes for our wedding. Fantastic. The cupcakes were delivered on time to the venue. The cupcakes were fresh and in perfect shape. They were fluffy and delicious. Our guests couldn't stop talking about them and eating them! We ordered chocolate, vanilla, carrot and red velvet. The frosting was great and the cupcakes were decorated exactly as specified.
The only comment I would have is that I wanted to order the cupcakes early (3 months before our event). However, when I called they said I would have to call back 2-3 weeks before the event. A little nerve wrecking as a bride but it worked out great!

I loooove the cupcakes here. I think I've tried almost every kind there is! My favorite is the Cookie Monsterrrr.. Mmmmm~ I always get a cupcake to eat there & a bunch to go since it's a mission to get there in the first place. I can't help but share the delicious goodness with everyone back home :)

I love that you can put extra sprinkles if you want to decorate your cupcake... or if you like more sugar :p

The only thing I hate is looking for parking.

I can't believe I haven't written a review of Molly's earlier!  

I am in love with these cupcakes.  I know everyone has a preference, but for me the balance between the cake and their frosting is on point.  The cake is nice and fluffy--and don't forget flavorful.   Sometimes you order a cupcake from a shop and it feels like they spent all of the time on the frosting, but not the cake?  Or it's the other way around?  Not Molly's!  

I've been known to make impromptu trips to Molly's if I'm in the area, and hell, let's face it: I even made a trip here from the suburbs when I had no where else to go (don't judge me).  

Parking has been super difficult for me and it's far, so I don't come often, but I always big up Molly's to friends, family and strangers.  I don't care, I will let you know.  

The service has always been nice, even when they are frazzled by a constant deluge of cupcake lovers.  

Now, I have a craving to go to...well, you know where!

The best word to describe the cupcakes? Irresistible! The red velvet cupcake really does live up to its hype. The cake batter is a second favorite.  A great place for a date or just to hang out with your friends.

Okay anyone that thinks THIS place is a splurge should check out some of the cupcake places in the Loop. This isn't too bad, and the selection is much more varied and the staff much more unpretentious than some other cupcakeries in this city.

The red velvet and anything with chocolate ganache or cream cheese icing is a winner. Moist and sizeable (nothing worse than a too small expensive cupcake, seriously) this place makes a great stop while you wait for your table to be ready at Toro next door. I love having dessert first, don't you? So if you're in the neighborhood for dinner, definitely give this cute little place a try.

Pure deliciousness with frosting on top!
So many lovely little cupcakes to choose from (Go for the nutella/peanut butter. sooo good!).
Go with a few friends after a day at the zoo or shopping in Lincoln Park, grab a seat and a board game and enjoy!

I had the Ron Bennington that everyone raves about...

Oh yes it was *snaps fingers*: chocolatey, rich, moist, peanut buttery filling, really sweet.

Oh nuh uh it wasn't *snaps fingers*: cheap, light, big.

Overall, I can't say I've developed a firm opinion of Molly's yet. I feel like I prefer simple light cupcakes instead of fancy ones, and Molly's makes fancy cupcakes. They  are filled with cream and peanut butter and all sorta stuff. I think such fillings tend to make the cupcakes overly sweet for my taste. Also, they are quite expensive considering the size of the actual cupcakes, but I guess the richness sorta makes up for that? Iono, all these conflicting thoughts made Molly's less than a memorable experience for me.

Go if you're in the area. I wouldn't recommend hunting it down though.

Absolute best cupcakes ever. Always stop here when visiting or traveling through Chicago. The Mixed Berry is amazing.  Kahlua, Birthday Cake batter, and Ron Bennington all very good. A little pricy compared to other cupcake places, but well worth it.  Molly's is  the standard I use to judge all other cupcakes.

I am a cupcake fan and that Ron Bennigan cupcake is officially my guiltiest of pleasures.  And even though this place is always busy, you never feel overlooked.  The people there are happy and very outgoing.

I go there every chance I get.  You should too!

Molly's has their business down to a T.

First of all, to be successful, your product has to be good, and boy, does Molly's start off on a good foot in that department! Their flavors are unique, the cupcakes taste fresh, the cake isn't dry and the frosting is decadent and delicious. I had three different cupcakes, and surprisingly, although the filled cupcakes were incredible and fun, my favorite was the most simple: a chocolate cake with vanilla frosting. You just can't go wrong with that combo. I definitely feel that the cupcakes were worth their somewhat expensive price.

The employees were friendly and seemed to enjoy their job (I sure would!). They ask you if you want sprinkles if you create your own cupcake, which was a nice touch. And oh yeah....they have SWINGS in the store. You can sit on a swing while you eat your cupcake, and instantly catapult back in time into your childhood. It's such a fun space, and I think that is what makes Molly's shine. The atmosphere is just perfect for a store that sells treats, to the point that simply going to Molly's is a treat!

I will certainly be back for more fun and delicious cake!

It's all been said before... repeatedly... 700 and some times. So I'll go over my favorites and would rather choke than eat that again cupcakes.

Apple Pie:

Delicious. Love the fruit filling center and creamy frosting. I could do without the slab of puff pastry on top. Not necessary.

Peach:

Also delicious, but it took me a while to get to the cupcake because the canned slice of peach on top of the whipped cream-style frosting really freaked me out. I think the cheap cost of ingredients is driven home upon seeing that. Skip.

Cookies & Cream:

Holla! Dense and moist cake, so sweet your teeth hurt frosting.

Boston Cream:

Eh. I think I was looking for something more magical and it just wasn't happening here. Was it tasty? Yes. Inventive and added on to the experience of Boston cream pie? Nope.

The center-filled ones are going to set the wallet back a bit, over $4/cupcake. Stick with the simpler frosted ones.

I don't get the cupcake trend. I mean, they've been around forever, now all of a sudden people want to pay 4 bucks for one? It makes me want to open up a store that just sells turkey sandwiches for $8, causing everyone to flip out. "ZOMG why didn't they think of this sooner?!?!?!"

Despite my general jadedness for the cupcake fad, Molly's is amazing. Their sweets are some of the better ones I've had, and their location in Lincoln Park is dangerously close to my apartment. I say dangerously because there's a number of Molly's creations that lead to indecision when ordering, consequently leading to ordering both/all, and subsequent penalty miles to make up for the calorie a-bomb of deliciousness.

I mean, how do you pick between the peanut butter cupcake with Nutella filling inside, and the Cookie monster, which has chocolate chip cookie dough inside? Answer. You don't. You have both.

I used to be a big Molly's Cupcakes fan, but after a couple of visits and trying some other cupcakes around the city, it's no longer my fave.

I saw the Cupcake Wars episode on Food Network, and I think she is very innovative with her flavors.  I like how they offer the mini cupcake size, it's convenient when buying for a small group of people

So I've tried the Red Velvet with Cream Cheese frosting, Tiramisu, Cookie Monster, Ron Bennington, and of course Vanilla.  I think the cupcakes are too dense for me, and don't really have the moistness that I'm looking for.  I felt like the frosting and the outside was hard, almost feeling kind of stale.  Then the inside is undercooked sometimes, or it just feels so heavy when I eat it.  

I think it's fun to taste their unique concoctions, but I've had more moist and flavorful cupcakes.  Parking is also super difficult in this neighborhood, which is another downside for me.

Alrighty, what does it mean when you find yourself at Molly's 6x in one month?  I don't live in the city, but find myself gravitating to this delightful local sweet shoppe   Molly's cakes are dense and delicious.  Love the variety and specialty cakes.  fun creations!

There is a small cohort of folks like myself that are not big on frosting and scrape off most of it and eat just cake. I stuff Molly's cakes into my mouth..straight up.;P 3 bucks...gone in 60 seconds.

Here are my top favs (thus far):
Red velvet-love the cream cheese frosting!  
Minty Mash Up-for the mint chocolate chip fans
Peanut butter nutella
boston creme

Not so great..
german chocolate-waaay to sweet

I ordered several dozen for a birthday party and they were a big hit.  It was an assortment (chocolate, vanilla, banana, carrot, red velvet).  They did a great job decorating the cakes with fun candy toppings and presentation was top notch.  THe take out containers (5 cents each) were useful for those leaving the party early.    The birthday girl got a "mega cupcake", slgihtly larger than the regular cakes.  stick a candle on top and wah lah!

Next time i would have ordered some of the specialty cakes with fun fillings to spice up the order=D

Friendly service...ah'll be back...(schwarzenegger voice over)

I was around when Molly Cupcakes first opened. My favorites included the homemade granola with milk and the hot apple cider. I also really loved the carrot cake cupcake.  I haven't been back because I am not in the area much lately but I would go back.
Some of the cupcakes didn't impress me BUT its been a while. I'm guessing since Molly's is still open that its doing well since many cafes and restaurants in that area close for some reason.

I loved the decor because its fun. The swings and bar is a cute touch. Its also a fun place to go to hang out with friends and play the board games (jenga, ect..) they have available.
No hot chocolate, anything steamed or espresso drinks 2 hours before closing, 15 degrees on a friday, snow falling....uber weak.  I wanted a GD hot chocolate!

Without a doubt, the best cupcakes I've had are at Molly's! My personal favorites are the peach cobbler (not too sweet, plus its fruit-filled) and blueberry crisp. However, I've never been disappointed with any order. My friends rave about the cookie dough cupcake, caramel apple and birthday cake. Of course, red velvet is delicious too.

Expect lines at all times (even on what would be a 'slow' period- Thursday afternoon, I was in line. Parking is also a bit of a challenge being in the middle of Clark St in Lincoln Park, but the mouthwatering decanance that is Molly's always makes up for this.

$3.75 for a cupcake may appear too much (and I always feel some guilt spending this on a single center-filled cupcake), but the explosion of sweetness that occurs once I eat a cupcake from Molly's is completely worth it! Who knew eating cupcakes could be so sensual!

other than crumbs in new york, this is my second cupcake place ever.  We came before the huge line formed and it was worth it!! The cake was moist and flavorful so it held it's own against the sweet, soft frosting! I got the red velvet but the "star" was their seasonal pumpkin cupcake!

Molly's Cupcakes confuse me.

We bought some two weekends ago - chocolate decadence, nutella, peach cobbler, and triple berry.  All were super fresh, and tasty.

The peach cobbler was my fave because it had whipped cream as the frosting which i can never find on cupcakes.  Whipped cream is absolute favorite on cake of any kind.  The cake had a good mix of cinnamon and sugar topping on it and it was oh so good with the whipped cream on top.

But then we bought more cupcakes a week later. The same exact flavors...and they weren't that hot.  All were a little dried out and overbaked. it was a bad day at Molly's.

So they won me over one week but left me saying "huh? what happened?" the next week.

Maybe I'll try it again...as long as they offer whipped cream cupcakes. I can't find any other bakery in town that offers that!

The service was poor.  I mean how do you run out of mini cupcakes?  You're a cupcake store with two cupcake sizes. That's like a burger joint running out of burger patties! About the cupcakes: Above average cupcakes at a high cost.
Great flavors!! :D And they look adorable in the box.

Molly's Cupcakes... will you marry me!?!?! I'm in love! We were in lakeview area getting a bite to eat and had heard sooo much about this spot from a local friend. So we decided to stop on it. It was very crowded so we took our cupcakes to go to the starbucks across the street.. I got the peach cobbler cupcake and my friend got the nutella PB cupcake... both were delicious... but the whipping on the top of my peach cobbler cupcake... OMG! Heaven! Thanks so much for the wonderful memory. I still go to sleep at night dreaming about this cupcake! I will definitely be coming back to see you sooN! =)
This is the best place ever. I can drown myself in delicious goodness. I have to drive for 30 minutes to get there [lake County think about it] but it is worth it. Love love love those cuppy  cakes.

I am on a journey right in to a vegan world and it is just my luck that Molly's has vegan goodness for sale!!!!. I bought the 2 flavors they have (yes only 2 flavor kinda sad) I gobbled the chocolate one up and it was so good, not too sweet and the chocolate is not over powering. Yum!  It was kinda dence like a brownie but it was just what I needed after 1.5 weeks of vegan eatin' with hardly any sweets.  I haven't tried the other one (vanilla) yet that will be later today. I only wish they had more choices, but I am sure there it's because not many people ask for them.
P.S I still stand by my original post!!! Oh soooooo good!!!

I realize about 400+ people have beaten me to reviewing Molly's, so I'll add my quick 2 cents. Obviously, the cupcakes are amazing. So far my favorite is the chocolate decadence and my (nick)name's sake, the Cookie Monster.

I'm not a self-proclaimed cupcake whore like many reviewers say. I'm just a regular sugar whore. So can I just say that the brownies here are also totally amazing, and not frequently talked about. They are perfect if you're (gasp!) not in the cupcake mood (gasp! gasp!!!). I also love that they're open late, until 12am on Friday and Saturday!!

Get ready to drop about $3-$4 dollars on a filled specialty cupcake, I appreciate that their basics (plain chocolate or vanilla, etc) are just $2.

BEST CUPCAKE.  Way better than any other place in Chicago I've had before.  If my metabolism hadn't slowed from my earlier years, I'd eat this place everyday.  It never gets old.

Red Velvet Cupcake with Vanilla Icing.

After hitting Telpulco (Spelling incorrect) we decided Molly's would be a great dessert option -and its open till 10!

So if you don't want to park - but want a little Molly goodness, what ever should you do?  Well My wife and I pulled into the corner lot for Einstein Bagle (next to a a very ugly looking tow sign, but no one parked there).

My wife kept the car running, and I ran into Molly's.  You know - this place is an exaggeration of the $$$$ raiting system. It cost 8.00 for two small cupcakes. I mean I KNOW, its still only 8 bucks. . .but the cupcakes were small.

I'm not saying the cupcakes weren't worth it.  Fantastic cupcake, I love it, and I will eat here again - even though its a little pricey.   I ran back to the car, and we were back to the burbs with two cupcakes in tow -without any hassle from E.Bagels.

Of all the cupcakes restaurants in Chicago and the surrounding neighborhoods, Molly's is by far my favorite.  Not only is the place adorned adorably, but -- most importantly -- the cupcakes are phenomenal.   Each specialty cupcake is awesome but my favorite is just a plain chocolate with chocolate frosting -- no sprinkles, and they happily prepare it right there for me.  But "plain" is an understatement as that cupcake is DELICIOUS -- very rich and perfect!

I never knew about this cupcake bakery, until my cousin mentioned they have the best cupcakes.  I live in Los Angeles, but I'm from Chicago.  So when I went back to visit one year, I had to make a trip on over here to see what the talk was about.  Molly's is a cute lil bakery, and they offer a lot of different types of cucpakes along with drinks such as coffee and lattes.  There's so many flavors to choose from, and fillings that you may stand there for a bit to decide like I do haha  My 2nd trip there, we chose to go in here for our engagement photo shoot with our photographer on one COLD December morning last year.  We got their red velvet cupcake, along with a coffee and they both turned out to be yummy props for our shots which was perfect since the red velvet had heart-shaped sprinkles on top!  Molly's is a must to try out if you're in Chicago and a cupcake fan as myself!

The best cupcake store in Chicago. They have many creative cupcakes, but for me, I go for a large vanilla cake with chocolate frosting and sprinkles. No hustle. No gimmicks. Just a simple cupcake. Perfection. Always friendly service. Clean store. A happy place, no doubt.

I am in DC working for the summer and my birthday is this Friday... I have been to every cupcake place in the city, yet nothing comes close to Molly's in Chicago.... So this is my request to you:

Please go to Molly's and buy a peach cobbler cupcake, a vanilla cupcake with french buttercream and a Ron B cupcake. Hum happy birthday for a quick second and eat up.... I'll pretend like I can hear all you guys celebrating.

This place is as good as it gets. No complaints, except the wait because boy when you see those cupcakes, seconds feel like hours.

Cheers

Love Molly's! The sprinkle station is a fan favorite of my three kids. Whenever we head this way into the city, we always stop in.

Very friendly staff. Red velvet is a personal favorite.

Ron Bennington is amazing! MOST amazing, moist, BEST cupcakes EVER! YOU must come here and try them all- from the peach cobbler to the cookie monster which is actually filled inside with cookie dough to the butterscotch caramel!  You can't be wrong with any flavor you try!

I've tried Sweet Honeybee's Bakery and now Sprinkles Cupcakes and I've come to the conclusion that I'm just addicted to the injected center filled cupcakes the Molly's has in their preschool/kindergarten themed shop.  Personally The Ron Bennington alone has me devoted to their cupcakes and I always seem to leave that place with a box when initially going in to just buy one cupcake.  As long as Molly's Cupcakes keeps inventing new injected center filled cupcake flavors my loyalty will never waver.  I had to deduct one star because I'm not a big fan of their non-center filled cupcake flavors.

Must Have:
- The Ron Bennington
- Tiramisu
- Peanut Butter Nutella
- Minty Mash-Up
- Cookies-n-Cream
- Boston Cream

I'm not a cake/cupcake person, but my boyfriend and I were taking his family from out of town to the area and stopped by. The workers behind the counter were very nice and let us take our time ordering and didn't rush my bfs cousin even though he ended up holding the line about ten people deep. He ordered a dozen so they probably didn't mind.

Now on to the cupcake. I ordered a cookies n cream and bought my boyfriend a Boston cream. Never got to taste his because he devoured it before I got a chance. First off, it's very moist to the point that it started crumbling and I'm a messy eater so no big deal. Secondly, I'm the type of person who always skims frosting off because I'm not a fan in general, but there was no way around it and I actually enjoyed it.

I still don't understand the cupcake craze cuz nobody goes gaga over slices of cake even though they're the same damn thing. Also the prices are up there- I paid almost $9.00 for those two cupcakes but they're more expensive because of the filling. It's good, but I'm not willing to cash out that much money for average sized cup cupcakes no matter how good they taste in the near future.

Pretty great little cupcake place. Not my favorite, but definitely definitely up there. I went there with my dad on a Friday night and it was packkedd. We both ordered custom cupcakes.

I chose vanilla cupcake with brown butter icing and cookies crumbled on top. The vanilla cake was suppper moist and the icing was DELICIOUS. Super super sweet.

My dad got the banana bread cupcake with chocolate frosting. Decent but no where near as good as mine. The banana bread wasn't very sweet, it would have been great bread (especially if it was warm) but not so good as a cupcake. The chocolate icing was decent, but I've had better.

Cute place, I recommend checking it out if you want cupcakes. If you just want any dessert I recommend Sweet Mandy B's on Webster.
Going to dream about the peach cobbler cupcake tonight. Mouth watering deliciousness. Enough said.

SO I had these my first time at a friend's party. She got these instead of a traditional cake & I was sooooo glad she did!  I couldn't stop myself; I wanted to try all of the flavors but they were so big that I could only ask people to cut a piece so that I could not pig out!  I'm not a big cupcake fan but these were like the most decadent cupcakes I've ever had!

Holy crap. I just had THE BEST vanilla/vanilla cupcake of my life. The buttercream was rich, but not too greasy or sweet, and the cake part was dense, moist, and flavorful. I'm so glad I was craving vanilla so that I got a chance to experience this amazing thing! You know a bakery is good when something so simple is incredible.

@ Ashley Y.
You must have the wrong person, Kelli is the sweetest! I LOVE their cupcakes... they make my day!!!

Molly's I am still a fan. I have had the chance to go around and taste different cupcakes around the city and this is the one place I come back to again and again. Loved their red velvet the first time I went and I always find it hard not to order that same flavor all the time. I have tried other cupcakes and they are always very tasty.

I don't think I come back over and over because of the frosting, but it's because they have a solid cake going on. The cupcakes are moist. Cupcakes at some places are either overloaded with frosting, but Molly's has the balance of really moist tasty cake with a good chunk of frosting. I just ordered their minis the other day of course the red velvet was just as good as the gigantic one. The other flavors were just as scrumptious.

To me a good cake over frosting wins, but the balance of the two is divine.

I've never actually been here but my friend has bought my cupcakes from here..twice!

The first cupcake I had was the tiramisu. Now I'm actually not a big fan of that but even I liked the cupcakes.

The second time, she bought me 6 cupcakes..cake batter! OMG. DELICIOUS. The cake batter actually oozed out of the cupcake. Good thing I don't live near by!

Loooveee it..
The cake baker cupcakes are ORGASMIC!!!!!
Love the cupcakes here! My favorite is the cake batter cupcake. They also catered our wedding and the cupcakes were a huge hit. I can honestly say I have not had a better cupcake!

These are the best cupcakes I have ever had. I used to get Sprinkles cupcakes all the time until I had Molly's. With amazing fillings inside they beat out Sprinkles any day. Me and my boyfriend are hooked on them and go about once every other week. The hot chocolate is also amazing and a must for when we go. I wish that they would serve it all year around and not just when its below 40 degrees.
love the chocolate ones (especially ganache), but not the fruit ones!

OK....I've been here 4 times now. My favorite is the blueberry cheesecake.  I'm not crazy about the red velvet.  The cream cheese frosting is not cream cheesy enough.  I also, go for the butterscotch carmel and pumpkin spice.  In case you haven't figured it out.  I don't like chocolate and can't eat peanut butter.  Now, I think the cake is better @ Molly's.  I find the cake @ More and Sugar Bliss a bit dry.  The only drawback?  Like someone else said, I would like more cake.  This can be done thru current size, lower price and less overwhelming fillings.  Or, make the cupcake bigger and keep the price and the fillings.  

Oh, and it was a really cold and windy day and there was a 20 min. wait for hot choc...!!!!????

Moderation is the key in terms of executing a delectable dessert so I was pleased to experience Molly's Cupcakes while I was in town visitng friends and family for the holidays.

Despite the 900+ reviews, I wanted to comment on the aesthetic layout of the dessert shop.  Most places are uninspiring or generic when it comes to architectural designs however, Molly's Cupcakes store conjure pictures of Candyland in my opinion.

When you first walk in, it is a bit crowded but when you look at the thought put into designing this store, they really hit the mark. Off to the left side of the store is a counter reminiscent of the 50s style parlors your parents or grandparents may have frequented but instead of the typical swivel bar stools, four swings suspended from the ceiling act as place for you to sit and enjoy your coffee and cupcakes.

Off to the right side are 3 circular tables and along the walls are benches where groups can congregate and round stools at each side of the tables provide additional seating.

When you order your cupcakes, it looks like the cupcakes are baked on the premises since industrial size ovens are visible along with trays and trays of cupcakes ready to be displayed behind the glass casings.

It was already 10pm on a Thursday night so much of the options were limited so all they had left where gingerbread, carrot cake and chocolate and rasberry cupcakes.  I heard the red velvet cupcakes were to die for but didn't see any on display.

I was a bit bummed but my friend recommended the create your own cupcake with the options of vanilla or choclate as the base along with the chocolate, vanilla or french butter cream frosting to name a few.

I'm a big fan of butter cream despite the fact you're eating a stick of butter mixed with powdered sugar but didn't care.  Different bakeries can mess up butter cream frosting but Molly's frosting was light and not overwhelming sweet.  As I mentioned before, moderation is the key to a good tasting dessert.

Once the cupcake was created along with the sprinkles, I immediately inhaled it.  The frosting melted in my mouth and the vanilla cake was fluffy.  The cupcakes were sized appropriately and the cost was about $2.75.  Gotta love Midwest prices!  

Overall, I'd come back to Molly's to experience the rest of the creations and kudos to the architect for this cute store!

This place has a hip and youthful atmosphere for people of all ages. It was crowded when I arrived there around 10:00pm on a Sunday night. They have a variety of cute cupcakes, such as red velvet and mixed berries. Their chocolate cupcake with raspberry filling exceeded my expectations.

I like how this restaurant incorporates the school theme with its wall decoration. Be sure to read the humorous description next to the items (i.e. a pair of skates) on the wall.  

PS There are board games like Connect Four on the tables for your entertainment.

pics.caption: Dark chocolate cupcake with rasberry filling

review.des:
Love, love, love this place. Whenever I feel like I want a cupcake this is my first pit stop!! I've tried other places, but the red velvet cupcake with the butter cream frosting is my favorite!! The cupcake is super moist and it melts in your mouth while the frosting is just right-- not to sugary that it makes your thirsty (if you know what I mean).

I will definitely be coming back before I leave for school again!!! :)

So, I have a sensitive stomach and when I eat too much, I tend to vomit.  I swear, telling you this is relevant to this story later on.

I came home to Chicago for Labour Day weekend and stayed with my sister and her husband for the first few days.  Literally, we planned our time around food.  She insisted that we come here for cupcakes after a peking duck feast and I was looking forward to the red velvet with cream cheese frosting.  We stop to pick some up and they were all out!  The girl behind the counter was really apologetic when she saw that I was about to cry after I told her that I was from Boston and came here specifically for that.  I ordered up an apple pie and a carrot cake instead.  By the way, the inside is super cute with a classroom feel.

The apple pie was AMAZING.  I don't really caps in my reviews but this is deserving.  The cake was moist, the apple filling was sweet, the frosting light as air, and the little cookie thing on top was crunchy.  I wonder if they can make a huge one as a cake for me someday.  The carrot cake was also very delicious.

My sister wanted a red velvet too and decided that we would come back the next day.  We did, after a huge breakfast.  I took a deep breath, made room in my stomach, and ate up that red velvety goodness with the super smooth cream cheese frosting.  Bad idea.  After basically participating in an eating marathon for 2.5 days, my stomach revolted and I threw up because I wasn't used to such rich and fatty foods.  I was never as sorry as I was then to purge something so delicious and lamented the waste of a perfect cupcake, while my sister fussed over me for being sick.

However, you bet your bottom dollar that I will be back for that apple pie cupcake the next time I am in town - and it will be one of the first things I eat.

My favorite cupcake in the city is Molly's red velvet with cream cheese frosting. The cake is moister than Sprinkles' and the frosting not as sweet, which I prefer.

I've had a bunch of the specials here. If you don't have a sweet tooth, it's probably best to stay away from the ones without a fruit component to balance out the chocolate, vanilla, or buttercream frostings. The mixed berry and chocolate raspberry ones are particularly good.

Cute place.

I got the RED VELVET cupcake and it was extremely moist and the cream cheese frosting was good. However, i wish it was thicker. the frosting was light and spreadable.

you should go!

LOVE Molly's Cupcakes!! I've been coming to Molly's since they were located on Briar Street. They are awesome!!! Peach Cobbler is by far my favorite, but you can't really go wrong with anything they have. Thanks Molly's!!!!

ABSOLUTELY ADORE THIS PLACE.

I'll admit I've gone here 4 times in one week. Cupcakes are ALWAYS fresh and cakes are beautiful. I was so glad to hear that they were on Cupcake Wars on the Food Network, I saw the episode and I gotta tell you, they rocked it. Really nice atmosphere and cute boxes that wont let your beautiful little things of heaven get damaged. Service is always quick and the people behind the counter are bloody nice. LOVE IT.

My favorite cupcakes thus far! We were a group of 5 and ordered 5. All winners! They are all moist and flavorful without being sickeningly sweet. The surprises in the center are so fun. They have reject ones that are cosmetic mistakes that are sold for less, but taste the same. I would eat here everyday if it weren't for diabetes.
Cookie Monster cupcake is phenomenal. Cake batter is really good too, but messy. You can't go wrong with any of them.

I'm vegan and I love cupcakes. I walked in and was very excited to see all the pretty little cakes lined up and made fancy - red velvet, cookies and cream, tiramisu, potential yum.

Unfortunately, the vegan cupcakes were limited to either chocolate or vanilla. Instead of being plucked out of the case filled with pretty little cakes, they pull out a plastic tupperware container with tiny, dry reject cupcakes and add the frosting to order. I chose vanilla on vanilla.

98% sure the warm, oily "frosting" mess wasn't vegan. I know dairy and I know cupcakes.

I told the girl at the counter that I didn't think the frosting was vegan and she said "I think I used the vegan one..." Her voice trailed off. She asked another coworker who said something along the lines of "That should be the vegan frosting. I'm sorry if there is any reason it isn't vegan." I don't know if the unlabeled pastry bags were confused or what, but if you're calling a cupcake "vegan" that means the frosting needs to be too. Total disappointment.

I am soooo sad that I have moved away and cannot get Molly's anymore.  I used to live a block away and getting 2 chocolate cupcakes with vanilla frosting was my Friday night treat after a long week at work (yes, I ate 2 cupcakes for dinner, don't judge).  And that is why I love Molly's.  You can get a plain chocolate cupcake with plain vanilla frosting.  No muss, no fuss.  Even the sprinkles are optional.  

I don't like filled cupcakes, they usually end up being too rich for me, so I can't really comment on Molly's filled ones.  But their chocolate cupcake is moist and the vanilla frosting (not buttercream) is not too sugary sweet.  They keep the plain ones in tupperware containers until you order, then they take them out and frost them up real quick.  That's the key to the awesomeness, because they don't sit out in the air for hours, drying them out.  It's the perfect cupcake.  I've yet to find somewhere else that has plain cupcakes with plain frosting, and trust me, I've looked to the tune of at least 10 other cupcake places both in Chicago and here in CA.  Oh, and they're only $2.

YUM! I get the lemon meringue every time. Perfect!

If the giant tempting cupcakes, or bright and fun atmosphere are not enough to bring you inside and give Molly's a try, then the amount of large people shamelessly standing in line to get their gigantic 1000 calorie cupcakes should sell you!

They are that good!

We ordered a variety of items for our wedding, including cupcakes, pies and cheesecakes. Everyone loved it. The only reason we had leftovers is because we ordered so much food. There were so many options for the cupcakes and I have a massive sweet tooth, so deciding which ones to order was difficult. I picked up and delivered our order to the venue, in Lake Barrington. Molly's delivery charge was pricey, but only because of the distance they would have to travel. It probably would have been worth in hindsight.

Unfortunately, I must dock them a star today. You see, I finally tried two of their regular cupcakes and I was unimpressed.

I ordered a red velvet and a carrot, both with cream cheese frosting. Normally, I am a huge cream cheese frosting fan, but this time definitely not. It tastes like they literally put a bunch of cream cheese on top of my cupcake. There was no sweetness to it at all, and it sorely needs some. It was a definite counter to the cupcake, which often works, but this wasn't a good counter flavor sadly.

The cupcakes were both moist, which was good, but not very flavorful at all, which was disappointing. There was no spice or 'bite' to the carrot cake and nothing special about the red velvet. They were just kind of bland. Oh well.

Really though, Molly's is known for their center-filled cupcakes, which are totally amazing. I do think they should work on their regular cupcakes, which at the moment, really aren't anything to write home about. Back to the center-filled it is for me!  I recommend: Mixed Berry, Chocolate Raspberry, Chocolate Mousse, and Pumpkin Spice in winter (one of their best!).

When it came to deciding our dessert for the wedding, there was really no discussion about it.  We knew we wanted Molly's to do cupcakes for our reception!  

I'm wondering if this whole "Weddings by Molly's" is a new thing because the woman I got a hold of was Lindsay and had a Gmail address.  Which usually is a red flag for me not to do business, but we know Molly's well so we took the chance.  And it was a great one!!

The tasting was SO much fun though SO filling!  You try their 4 standard cupcakes with a stripe of frosting across the top to see which icing you like best (we found out we're NOT butter cream people!)  And then anything they have made in the case you could try and see if you liked them.  So I finally tried the Ron Bennington and we tried their winter seasonal mint chocolate one.  

You have a TON of choices.  You can dye your icing for a ridiculous price of something like $3 for your order.  Add all kinds of toppings!  Mix and match!  Too fun!  We went with 4 flavors of mini cupcakes for our guests and then one mega cupcake as a 'topper' for us.  

They delivered the cupcakes promptly to our caterer and they looked fantastic.  The packaging was great and no one arrived smushed!  All-in-all yet another fantastic Molly's experience on a whole other level!

I am a cupcake aficionado, and I am definitely a fan of Molly's Cupcakes.  When I lived in Lincoln Park I was in there at least twice a month... if not once a week.  Nutella and a good old fashioned red velvet with cream cheese icing are my favorites.  I also adore the dinosaur shaped sprinkles.  I make it my mission to bring visiting friends to Molly's for dessert.

The only reason they get three instead of five stars is the price.  They're A-OK, but not AMAAAAAAAAYZING.  Yes, it's Lincoln Park, but the cupcakes aren't big enough for a $4 price tag.  Nor do all the cute details make it worth it.  Heck, I can get bigger cupcakes at Crumbs for the same cost, and that's downtown.

The owners are always super nice, and the coffee is good.  I like hitting them up on work days/school days when there aren't many people in the shop.  Saturday night?  Forgetaboutit.  They're packed.

I'll continue to go back.  That Nutella cupcake has me hooked, but it's too expensive for all but a once-in-a-while treat.

It seems I've took a bit of a break from you, Yelp.

Sorry.

Good to be back.

And what better to come bouncing back with a super-positive CUPCAKE review?

Okay, so.....

I had a Molly's once upon a time... and I was sad ( I WAS LIKE "WHOA IS ME!")

Miss Molly, maybe you had a bad day when you were making that dry sponge you called a cupcake.

I don't know...

But the stars aligned as I walked down Clark and had a definite taste for a cupcake..... Oh! But what do i see to my left...... The Holy Grail of cupcakeries in Chicagoland, the one that had failed me before....

Do I give Miss Molly another shot?

Of course I do.... I mean, if I didn't, this wouldn't be a 5 star review.

So I asked the lady (old girl, rather) which cupped cake should I get?

and she said "The Cookie Monster"

OKAY!!

How could you say no to such an adoooooooooooorable name?

Well, this manly man can't.

MMM..... It was sooooo good.

It's like a chocolate chip cookie, and not too sweet.
And in the middle..... COOOKKKIIIEEE DOOOOOUUUUGGGHHHHH.

NOM NOM NOM NOM.....

COOOKKKIIIEEEE.

Okay, it was good.

$3.75 though?

Meh.... not my money.

If you're paying though..... be economically smart.

That is all.

Love
Chaz

WOWIE..this place blew my mind with their delicious cupcakes..I am in LOVE with their red velvet with cream cheese frosting! DELISH!
Who wouldn't want to create your own cupcakes!?!? Their decadent and moist cupcakes topped off or filled with your liking...ill take a dozen thanks!

The only thing that caught me was that they're so expensive! I mean, they're delish but too expensive for a daily buy.

Absolutely craveable.  I had the strawberry shortcake cupcake.  It's a vanilla cupcake with a strawberry baked right in, white frosting, and a strawberry on top.  Mmm.  Moist and fluffy and refreshing. So yummy.

Cute shop.  MAJORLY busy, even for a Tuesday night, but service was fast and friendly.  I like the swing-seats at the bar.  I'm craving a cupcake now, so I figured I'd write a review instead.  :)

Next, I want to try the lemon meringue cupcake. I like fruity cakes.

Great for a quick dessert.  Don't bother if you are looking to spend real $$.  I asked to have a tasting to place an order for my wedding and was told they didn't have any time!!!  Ok, so I spent my $600 order at another fab cupcake shop who was happy to spend 20 minutes with me.  What a shame!

Holy Moistness Batman !!
