In all seriousness, the teacher theme is executed well here with swing seats at the bar, school chairs at the tables, and grade school related knick knacks on the walls.  Even the bathrooms execute the theme.  

The cupcake I had on my visit was good.  I had chocolate, which was moist and tasty, but the frosting was the real treat.  It was a buttercream that was light, and sweet, and damn near heaven.  

Those complaining about price need to take into acount that the main thing they are selling is cupcakes.  They don't have overpriced birthday cakes to drive their business.  They have to pay that high priced Lincoln Park rent with cupcakes and coffee.

So yes, while slightly smaller than the cupcakes I'm accustomed to, and slightly higher priced, if I'm in the area, or looking to hang around for some coffee, I will definitely head back to Molly's for a tasty sinful cupcake from my new favorite teacher.
Delicious cupcakes. Convenient place to hang out while waiting for a table to free up at Toro's a few doors down.

I don't even like cake that much, but during my first visit to Molly's last night, I wanted to curl into the fetal position with my red velvet cupcake and weep with joy.

I didn't, though.  I was there with 7 other people, most of whom I had just met earlier that day, so I think it would have been a little awkward.

But sometime, my friend Michele will come visit me, and since she loves red velvet cupcakes as I do, I will take her to Molly's and we will feast on red velvet and the most perfect cream cheese frosting ever, and I will not be ashamed to weep.

I know this sounds like sacrilege in Yelpland, but I don't often like cupcakes.  But I was walking past Molly's and remembered a review, and figured what the heck, let's see what she's got.  Good Golly Miss Molly.  Wow.  First, I love the decor.  One side is like an old fashioned soda counter, but with swings as seats.  I so have to go back and sit there (I wish they offered soda fountain drinks--that would so make it even more awesome for me).  Second, I liked the fact that you could MYOC (make your own cupcake), with base, frosting, toppings, etc.  For an extremely picky gal, this is like hitting the jackpot.  You can buy a mini cupcake for $1 (great for tasting different types), a regular for $2, or specialties (I think they ranged from $3-4).  I got a mini carrot cupcake, a mini red velvet cupcake, and one specialty one (I can't remember the name, but it was chocolate, with ganache on top, and peanut butter in the middle).  They were amazing.  The cream cheese frosting was some of the best I have had.  The red velvet and carrot cupcakes were just the right amount of mellow sweetness.  The chocolate/pb one was also great, but too rich to eat in just one sitting (that's ok--it stayed well in the box and tasted great the second day as well).
Molly, me and your minis, we could have a thing going on...

Great cupcakes! Definitely decadent, but their size is very reasonable (more of an actual home cupcake tin size). I enjoyed the Cookie Monster cupcake as well as a mini chocolate cupcake with chocolate frosting. The cookie dough on the inside of the Cookie Monster was a little too rich for my taste, but the chocolate frosting was phenomenal. I will definitely stick with a chocolate variety on my next visit! Also, their atmosphere is super cute and they serve good coffee.

meh,  i think i've become a cupcake snob.
positives:  really great variety and interesting possible combinations. red velvet and mint frosting? enticing.
the cupcakes are made to order- so you can choose what frosting you want on the cupcake.

staff there is really nice

negatives: the actual cake itself--the cream chese frosting is really dense, the cake is not as light and fluffy as other places.

overall, i prob wont' go back as there are alot better places here.

Molly I love your cupcakes!!!! Your addictive Red Velvet Cupcakes are super yummy!!!! Molly I love your cupcakes!!!! My mouth is just watering writing this review!!!! Molly I love your cupcakes!!!!! Doing the Homer growl!!!! I think I will head over to MC tomorrow because I need a cupcake!!! Molly I love your cupcakes!!! Did I mention I love your cupcakes?

Verryy unhappy with mollys cupcakes. I dont understand the hype of it! I had mollys cupcakes make my wedding cake with cupcakes. It was all wrong first the color for the cupcakes was not right when my husband picked up the cupcakes they told him to put some cupcakes in the fridge and the others are fine not being in the fridge.  I guess there top selling wedding person REBECCA did not tell my husband to put our wedding cake in the fridge. When it was time to put it out the cake fell the designs were falling off its horrible.  The only thing they cared about was money. When were they going to get it thats it!! I will NEVER go to mollys cupcakes ever again!! Horrible people.

I am not the type of person to spend over $2 for one cupcake however the friend I was with was insistent on buying a cupcake, so I splurged and went for the red velvet cupcake with chocolate frosting.  I was not disappointed.  My cupcake was delicious, my friend however LOVED his cupcake.  Said it was the best he has ever eaten, and he is a cupcake connoisseur.  He got the ron bennington (chocolate cupcake, filled with creamy peanut butter filling and butterscotch chips, topped with chocolate ganache and sprinkled with more butterscotch chips and crumbled butterfingers).
The store is pretty cute, with things to read on the walls about Molly.  They also have super cool bar seats that are swings!!
Oh and if you didn't get enough sprinkles on your cupcakes they have a few options for your own additions set up on a condiment bar.

I am a huge fan of cupcakes in general. Molly's Cupcakes whistles my tune every time. It's the quintessential bakery- very cozy and inviting as soon as you walk in the door. Their variety of cupcakes spans the range of heavily decadent to I-can-almost-convince-myself-it's-healthier-because-there's-fruit-on-it. I just had the Strawberry Shortcake and I wish I had purchased two. The strawberry hiding on the inside was like a tiny treasure. My favorite is still the Peanut Butter Nutella, but I make it a point to try a different flavor each time. Molly's is as highly recommended as they come in my book.

The cupcakes here are pretty awesome. They're delicious, they have a big, unique variety, and they're big enough to share (though I rarely do).

By now, I've tried most of the center filled cupcakes. The Ron Bennington, Cookie Monster, Chocolate Raspberry, and Red Velvet are always good, but by favorite is probably Peach Cobbler.

My only two complaints are that the cupcakes are kinda of expensive (though they're really big and really delicious, so...), and that the girls working there aren't always the nicest. I've been there a couple times and felt like we were inconveniencing them or something. I've also been told a cupcake I wanted was sold out, only to see them bring out a new tray by the time I was paying.

That being said, this is still my go-to place for cupcakes in Chicago.
While the interior is spacious and welcoming (music playing with a good selection of board games), their red velvet cupcake was mediocre. Their cake was not moist and soft. Prices are reasonable.

ah, molly's.

delightful cupcakes. making your own (cake type, frosting, additional ingreeds) is only $2. TWO DOLLARS! for the cupcake craze!!! by fancy-schmancy cupcake standards, that's incredible.

having said that, the specialty cupcakes are where it's at. they are a teeny bit more pricey, but it's well worth it.

last weekend, i tried the peanut butter nutella cupcake. it was heaven in a cupcake. no, really. little angels flowed right out of the cupcake after i took the first bite.

i love nutella, i love pb. i know some people don't. the boston creme cupcake is very good as well. pair either with milk and you've got yourself a dessert (or main course!) you won't forget.

the ron bennington is a popular cupcake, but i find it to be a leeetle too heavy. it's chocolate, it's peanut butter, it's packed. but some people are into that sorta thing.

now then, onto the decor. it is, in fact, adorable. the colors on the walls alone can bring anyone in. that is, if the assortment of board games in the windows doesn't beat them to it. connect four, chutes and ladders, jenga, yahtzee...you name it. tons of games. that you can play! i recently had an epic game of jenga in which there WEREN'T ANY MOVES LEFT. don't worry, i have phone pictures to prove it. the owners were quite impressed.

give it a shot. it's also a great place to go after eating at toro sushi two doors away or even if you're waiting for a table at toro sushi (they don't take reservations..and i swear i'm not plugging toro sushi..) or if you just want something sweet! i've found that this is the one bakery where people of all ages can find enjoyment.

I hate reviewing places when there are over 80 other reviews...

But I HAVE to give a shout out to Molly's!
I read here on Yelp that they had really yummy Red Velvet cupcakes.

So...one afternoon I was going to visit one my daughters that was attending the Beauty School down the street. She had befriended a gal from South Carolina who was also attending the school, and I knew her friend was getting "home-sick"
What BETTER reason is there than to bring "Red Velvet" cupcakes to them?!?!

Great clean shop, multiple little "cafe" tables, excellent staff, small yummy cupcake menu!

Favs: Red Velvet (only $2.00) Triple Chocolate ($3.50) Strawberry Shortcake ($3.00)

Molly you have done a beautiful thing!

I was having a bad day:
Yet another day of crankyness because I lost the eight-hour insomnia battle.
Again.  
Coffee wasn't cutting it, my sleep-deprived self needed serious backup to get thru the workday. Enter the delicious red-velvet cupcake with rich, real cream-cheese icing and sprinkles! Then I ate two then three... what a glutton! More!?! I had three!
I'm energized, My lips and tongue are a brilliant shade of scarlet and my tummy is happy.
I coasted on the tasty sugar rush to the end of the work day.

Sophisticated? Perhaps not... but you sit in a swing with a glorious cupcake confection and NOT smile.. go ahead... I double-dog-dare you!

(I told you you couldn't. It was fun to see you try.)

So I was with the wife to be, just getting some sushi up north when we both had a craving for something sweet. Behold mollys cupcakes, just saw it browsing yelp deicded to step in it was about 11pm on a friday night. The place was like a cupcake night club, music loud swing chairs and workers dancing to "look at that body". Cupcakes were delicious by the way big portions and the coffee was cheap but good to have with the cupcakes gotta take a look if your in the area.

.......wow.  Wow. Wow wow wow.

Not gonna lie, wasn't sure how a cupcake store could really be all that great, especially after visiting More Cupcakes, but this blew me away.  

The cupcakes are gorgeous and all of the flavors sound amazing.  After I decided on a Cookies n Cream to eat there and a Ron Bennington (chocolate, peanut butter, and butterscotch!) to go and my boyfriend got a Red Velvet to eat there and Chocolate Decadence and Raspberry Chocolate to go, we sat down.  And instantly fell into food bliss.  One bite of the deliciously chocolate cookiey cupcakeness left me with no other desires in the world than to finish the cupcake.  Chocolate undoubtedly smeared around my mouth, I glanced at my boyfriend and saw he was in the same state, cream cheese frosting stuck to the beard.  We ate those damn delicious cupcakes so fast.

After we finished our cupcakes, we came out of the happy comas enough to notice other elements of the store.  Sprinkles station! Cute!  Swing bar chairs! Adorable!  Board games! FANTASTIC!  This place is truly a treat and I cannot wait to go back and try all of the flavors.   Ok, Molly's, you showed me how good a cupcake store can be.

Definitely my go-to for cupcakes. I've tried many-a cupcakes from various places in the city, and nothing compares to Molly's. Especially the red velvet. I can't not get it when I come here. It's just so moist! It's like I'm not even eating a cake product. My boyfriend loves the blueberry cheesecake cupcake..He'll often order 2. 1 for now, 1 for later. They stay well in the fridge :) Try the others, but you'll be coming back!

I really wanted to love Molly's cupcakes - the store is adorable, there have been long lines several times when I've driven past, and the people who work there were SO nice. But the cupcakes themselves were very disappointing. I got four to bring home to share with the boy (two vanilla and two chocolate - one of each for each of us), and I splurged and had one from the build-your-own bar while I was there. The one I had at Molly's was vanilla cupcake with the brown-butter frosting I'd heard so much about. And it was good, but boy, was it sweet. They could probably halve the amount of sugar and it would still be sweet. The cake itself was still warm, so I was expecting something moist and gooey, and it wasn't - more like warm and kind of dry.

The sweet frosting and dry cake were a theme for the other cupcakes that we tried. Both of us thought the vanilla cupcakes were dry and bland, with very little actual vanilla flavoring (especially compared to the champion of vanilla cupcakes, Dinkel's), and the frosting was soooo sweet and even a little grainy from all of the sugar. The chocolate cupcakes were better than the vanilla - moister and with a richer flavor, and the sweet buttercream worked slightly better on the chocolate than on the vanilla. The boy had chocolate frosting on his chocolate cupcake and he was it was good, but still overly sweet for him.

Molly's is super cute, but I don't think we'll be back unless we're walking by when my sweet tooth hits me or I have a small child with me - because the sugariness and the decor are extremely kid-friendly.

I really have no idea what is with the 1-star (or even 3-star) reviews.

This place is pretty darn awesome.  My wife loves cupcakes, and love is an understatement, so I've sampled quite a few, and this place has damn good cupcakes.  In particular, the peanut butter chocolate is amazing.

Also, the space is great, the people are nice, and they have some sweet board games.

I think, before I review this, it's important to mention that I really don't have a sweet tooth.

With the exception of cupcakes...

Heavenly.  Walking into this darling (yes, I said darling) little bakery, I knew I was in love.  Serious cupcake love.  This spoken by a woman who has professed her undying devotion to Sweet Mandy B's...I loved it.

The varieties are creative and fun, the presentation is lovely, the swing chairs at the little bar?  Just too cute!  

We tried the strawberry shortcake cupcake (heavenly, as they hide a delicious little bit of strawberry on the inside) and the "Ron Bennington" cupcake...which is chocolate and peanut butter and out of this world!  Top that off with a hot cup of Intelligentsia and I'm in heaven.  But I think I already said that...just do NOT tell Sweet Mandy.  She'd never understand.

I've only had plain old chocolate so far and it's the best in the entire city hands down. Moist, filling, and oh so good for those monthly cravings ladies : ).

Btw, you can get mini cupcakes for a just a dollar each, so you don't have to shell out $3.75 for their more gourmet selections if you only have a little change in your pocket, but need a quick fix.

4.3 rating

$3.75 for a freakin cupcake!!!???!!!!  

you people are out of your mind to pay that much.  Yes, the cupcakes are good, BUT NOT THAT GOOD.  Let me remind you, ITS A CUPCAKE!!   Cupcakes are pastry's made for little children and are for some reason the cool thing to eat...but its still a child's desert (not saying its a bad thing)...but would you pay $8 for a bologna sandwich?

There are plenty of great bakery's (a bakery is a place IMO that sales more than cupcakes and cookies) that have much better selection of deserts, taste better or on par, and seating that makes this place feel like McDonald's play world.  

I take sweets a little too serious, so if your not a fair weather sugar connoisseur (wait until its not cool to say "Beth, look at this cute little cupcake I just bought") than please look at some of Chicago's other cool bake shops.  but for soccer moms w/ a little too much money on hand by all means fill Molly's up...I don't want to look at you when I'm stuffing my face in the bakeries I attend.

While on my self-directed Cupcake Tour of Chicago I stopped into Molly's to see if the hype was well deserved. Thankfully, Molly's offered mini-cupcakes that both my wallet and burgeoning stomach were thankful for after a weekend of cupcakery. The cupcakes were definitely cute and tasty but I found the frosting to be too heavy. Nevertheless, I think it's a must try at some point if you're nearby.

Maybe Chicago people don't know what a good cupcake should taste like...because the cupcakes were mediocre at best.  Tried the red velvet with cream cheese and a banana with butter creme.  The butter creme was good, but not great.  Cream cheese was pretty bad...red velvet was moist but chewy...which as a little odd.  Banana cupcake was dry.  Funny that there is a Sprinkles in Chicago and it got a lower rating and I think it tastes WAY better than this place.  The ambiance is pretty cool...it's open late with music going...like a fun late night coffee shop to hang out at.  Other than that, the cupcakes weren't that great.  If I'm in the neighborhood, I would have to say this place isn't worth a return visit.

If you are checking the reviews on Molly's cupcakes then you probably already know how amazing they are! The bakery is very cozy and feels like home. It is prefect for an outing with friends or a desert date. For chocolate lovers the Ron Bennington is a no brainer. Once you try them u will be craving for more. The peach cobbler is a must try.

HOLY MOTHER OF GOD. Best. Cupcake. EVER!

Husband and I went today and each got one. I got one of the vegan ones, a bit nervously (they can be dry, after all). It was a vanilla cupcake with chocolate frosting, and I can quite confidently say it was better than ANY cupcake, vegan or non-vegan, that I've ever had. So moist, tons of frosting... it just melted in my mouth!  It was the best $2 I have spent in my entire life :-)

I will be back - again, and again, and again...

Not to mention the space is super cute and the employees were super friendly. Fun tables to sit at, swings (yes, swings) at the counter, pillows, and even board games. They also do homemade ice cream which I'm sure is great, and have a great coffee/tea selection.

Go as fast as you can!!

PS. They have a sprinkle station. A SPRINKLE STATION!

Personally, these are the best cupcakes I've ever had.  Period.  Try the red velvet or the carrot cake or the tiramisu...  You get the point.  Not too sweet, not too dry.  Good, strong Intelligentsia coffee to wash them down.  

Great people watching along Clark Street, too.  This joint makes me want to live in the city!

Sweet Treats, Sweet People!

Everything about this place is cute--from the kid-friendly decor (indoor swings!) to the clever cupcake names, Molly's merchandise and the super smiley staff. I've tried EVERY cupcake shop in the city and each have their strengths and weaknesses but Molly's is the total package! The desserts are delicious and the service superb. I couldnt disagree more with "Luis M.'s" review--I go here often and have placed several pre-orders over the phone but the one time I didn't give enough notice they were polite and apologetic about being unable to accommodate a last-minute order. In fact, I've never seen anyone who works there be rude about anything (a rarity, I know). Maybe that's why I love it there so much. Or it could just be the blueberry cheesecake...either way I'm hooked. Check it out, you'll see what I mean. Enjoy!

Yes, their Tiramisu cupcake with heavenly filling was my 23rd birthday cake.

And yes, I cried.

The cashier was sweet enough to slide me a candle and not laugh as I plopped my grown ass down on that swing.

Sweet stuff. Nice service. Can be a bit pricey, but totally worth it.

Maybe next time I'll play some of the games.

This place is pretty awesome, and the fact that its open till midnight is pretty crucial for someone with a sweet tooth.
Their cupcakes are pretty good, but I wasnt insanely impressed. Maybe its becuase I went in towards the end of the day, but I didnt feel like my cupcake was particularly moist. I do realize it was the end of the day but, come on, if you're specialty is making cupcakes you should be able to make ones that can stay moist from the time you make them until  the last one is eaten... Maybe Im just spoiled.
But, if its late and you need a taste of something sweet, this is the place to go.

I've been to a few cupcake places and this is by far the best I've come across! I know it's all a matter of opinion and everyone taste buds are different but Molly's cupcakes are off the meter!!! My favorite is the Rainbow Sherbet cupcake. This thing is addictive and the chocolate decadence is also a favorite!!! If you want a good cupcake go to Sprinkles (a highly overrated place) or Flirty cupcakes but if you want a GREAT cupcake then by all means go to Molly's their a bit higher but their cupcakes is worth the extra few cents!!

My sister read about this place and after a trip to Yelp I decided to give it a try.  When I walked in and got to the display case, the filled cupcakes appeared very small to me at first.  Maybe it's just because I'm used to eating Costco muffins that are big enough for King Kong.  I got a peach cobbler and a minty mash-up, which along with a skim milk totaled $10.

Peach Cobbler cupcake - It was very moist, had a clear hint of cinnamon, and there was some peach puree filling.  There is also a huge amount of icing on top, as well as a slice of peach.  It was pretty tasty, but I would have liked more filling.  The icing had a nice taste and texture but there was so much of it that the cupcake got overwhelmed by it.  Overall it was much more substantial than it first looked and I liked it.

Minty Mash-up Cupcake - It was a moist, high quality chocolate cupcake with a bit of mint frosting inside and more on top, as well as a square of Hershey chocolate.  There were supposed to be mint chocolate chips in the filling, but I got a total of about two.  Again, not nearly enough filling, especially when the filled cupcakes cost nearly twice as much as the regular.  It tasted good and was also more substantial than it looked.

I polished off two filled cupcakes and a pint of milk in about five minutes.  I didn't leave hungry, but for $10 the experience should last longer than that.  Is it worth the price?  If you have the disposable income and love cupcakes you can't easily duplicate at home, yes.  If you're on a budget, definitely not.  I could get a whole coffee cake from a good bakery for what those two cupcakes cost.  If I had dinner at a nearby restaurant and wanted dessert, I would definitely stop in for one cupcake.  I just wouldn't go out of my way to go back when there are equal or better options closer to home (Hi Dinkel's!).

Okay,  since I am new to the area I try a lot of places for the first time.  I was invited to Molly's by a fellow yelper and apparently a future Molly's salesrep :-).  I don't have a major sweet tooth and my taste lean towards the basic so I was happy to see that they had red velvet cupcakes.  

I ate my cupcake sitting on a swing drinking coffee.  Okay let me see if I can give a better review.

I ate my moist, light, perfect little red velvet cupcake while I sat on a swing and drank some hella good coffee.  

Sometimes you go to places and wonder what all of the hype is about.  I totally get it when it comes to Molly's.  Their cupcakes are original and great.  Their staff makes you feel like you right at home.  Plus, I sat on a swing!!  

Great place..I will definitely be a repeater.
This place kicks some serious cupcake ass. The peach cobbler cupcake is awesome and the blueberry cheesecake is soooo good. Would def go back.

Mollys is greater than Sprinkles. I'm a fan of mainly homemade cupcakes, never store baked or bought. But oh my, this place changed my mind. I ordered the premade specialty cupcakes, peanut butter nutella and mixed berry. They also have a cupcake bar where you can customize it to your liking. I had the mixed berry first and the cake part was really moist and soft. I liked the filling in the middle. Frosting was ok, I'm not a big frosting person, but I still ate it. That's a making a statement. The peanut butter nutella cupcake tasted straight up like a peanut butter cookie, but in cake form. It was a bit dry, but still tasty. I liked the frosting on this one, but the nutella filling was too rich for me. Needed milk. =/

Pretty wonderful cupcakes, but really really what made the highlight of this trip was the staff and the place itself! The staff is really friendly, and when I requested a side of chocolate sauce they gave me a whole little bowl with dripping hot fudge sauce!!! I loved it!

I am totally still dreaming of a Molly's cupcake. I think I'll go get one right now!

I had high hopes for Molly's, and was excited at the cuteness of the place upon entering.  But that was where the good times ended.  The service was horrible.  Before I'd even had time to look at what was being offered I had 3 people asking me what I wanted and how many so that they could begin boxing up the order.  There was nothing pleasant about our exchange and I had the feeling that my presence was annoying them.  The same could be said when I paid - the cashier didn't say one word to me besides how much I owed him.  Right before leaving I said "Have a nice day!" to which he didn't bother responding.

Decided on 4 cupcakes, but didn't eat them until the next day.  The vanilla cupcake with vanilla frosting was stale the next day and the frosting was disgusting.  The lemon cupcake had far too much frosting and was just generally too sweet, so I tossed half of it.  My boyfriend liked the chocolate/candy cupcake.  But the worst part was the chocolate covered strawberry cupcake - after sitting in the box for approximately 18 hours, the strawberry was covered in mold.  It was disgusting.  The strawberry that was inside the cupcake was also gross and didn't seem to be mixed in with the cupcake very well.

For $3.75 a pop, I expect much more than this.  This cupcake experience, aside from the one cake my boyfriend liked, was disappointing from beginning to end.  For a good cupcake in Chicago, go to Sweet Mandy B's, or even Fox and Obel instead.

Although these cupcakes are pricey they are worth every penny! My favorite is the peach and the apple.  I love how they have filling inside as well as on the top. The frosting is amazing!! I brought several of their cupcakes to a dinner party and everyone was blown away buy them.  I'm totally hooked on Molly's!

BABY Cupcakes! Love em! For $1.00 I can savor a sweet little red velvet cupcake and not feel too bad about it.

Boston cream was a bit soggy, stepmom felt red velvet frosting should be more buttercream less cream cheese.

Plus the place is cute, wish there was more seating... but the swings are cool.

O.M.G. THE BEST CUPCAKES EVER!!!!! i have tried two other places that sell cupcakes in the city but none of them have topped my experience here.

I visited Molly's Cupcakes when a friend of mine was visiting Chicago for the first time and we were discussing the past weeks Food network Cupcake Wars where Molly's was the winner. I was really excited to go since my new thing living in Chicago is to try out restaurants and shops that are featured on the food network. after seeing the episode and then hearing the great gossip about the place from friends i had to try it out.

We went into the shop like kids in a candy store and didn't know where to start so we decided to get 6 flavors to have some variety. We became even more giddy when we say the winning cupcake from the show was being sold in the shop! Kiwi- Lemon cupcakes equal heaven! it as wonderful!! i nice lemon cake with fresh kiwi fruit filling with a light meringue frosting was delicious we now knew why they one the competition! we also ordered their Red Velvet (which has been voted best in the city), the Cookie Monster (which we found to be kind of dry), The Apple Pie, The Peach Cobbler (the best followed by the kiwi lemon its like Fall in your mouth! lol), and Strawberry Shortcake.  the cupcakes were great and the prices weren't as bad as i expected!(2 bucks for plain, 3.50 for filled cupcakes)

i really hope they keep the Kiwi Lemon cupcake around all year and if not it needs to be added to the seasonal flavor for summer and come fall the peach cobbler is going to be my treat because it is better than pie!!

i love this place and its great that it is open until midnight so it would be the ideal late night treat!! my friend hates that she has to go back to DC and that molly's doesn't ship nationally! lol

ummmmmmmmm.....those were the BEST cupcakes ever to reach my mouth!  wow...my wife, daughter and I were at a friends family event and i never had a "Molly's Cupcake".   We loved it instantly.  i read u guys make bday cakes too.....awesome.   cant wait till my Bday.  
thanks n congrats on ur sucess.
-L.

Upon entering, I couldn't help but at the case full of colorful, creamy, delicious looking cupcakes, brownies and cookies. Not until I was snapped out of it by the man behind the counter, did I notice how cute this place was. There are actual swings hung from the ceiling that make up bar seats. There are an assortment of games scattered across the tables that are arranged along the store front windows.
I bought an assortment of cupcakes and cookies which all turned out to fan-tabluous. I must recommend the Ginger cookies and Red Velvet cupcakes. To diiiiie for!

What a small little gem! With 50's music roaring in the background, cheerful staff, swingsets and bubbly interior - who wouldn't want eat a cupcake here?

So the story goes that the owner of this restaurant named this place "Molly's Cupcakes" after their 3rd grade teacher, Ms. Molly, who celebrated her student's birthday's with cupcakes.  I wonder if I would get a free cupcake on my birthday?

Well it wasn't my birthday, or my friends', but we stopped by for a chance to cheer her up (she was on her period).  She stopped her bitching when we she got her Chocolate Raspberry Cupcake.  The rest of my day was great.

I got the carrot cake cupcake with butter cream frosting.  They have 4 different types frosting to choose from.  The Raspberry-Green tea warmed me up, so did the ambience.  

Don't miss the Sprinkle Station with about 5-6 types of sprinkles to decorate your cupcake.

Greatest cupcakes in Chiiiicago!

Try the Ron Benningont cupcake and get ready to be in cupcake bliss!

p.s. cant wait for a Molly's NYC!

Since Molly's had gotten some very mixed reviews, I was sort of hesitant to try it.  But, last week I got a strawberry cupcake and was very impressed.  It was very light and fresh tasting-- vanilla cake filled with sweet and juicy berries and topped with the perfect amount of whipped cream frosting.  I asked myself-- what have people been complaining about?  This is awesome!  

But, then I said to myself, be reasonable-- try another.  And I did.  It was called the "Ron Bennington" and may be the most amazing thing I have ever put in my mouth.  It's a chocolate cake topped with chocolate ganache, Butterfinger crumbles, and butterscotch chips.  But the real treat was the peanut butter filling.  Sooo indulgent.  

The swings, games, sprinkle bar only add to the general cuteness of the place.

There have been many cupcake places that have tickled my fancy, but this one has actually stolen my heart. Perhaps it's Molly's warmth and tenderness. Or her attention to detail. Either way, my heart beats like a ticking time bomb every time I walk into this place.

My favorite is the Cake batter, brings me back to childhood and has just the right amount of sweet. The Peach Cobbler is also a strong contender, with little bits of sugar streusel and a peach puree filling that's to die for.

Cupcakes I regret: the lemon meringue (much too sweet in an articial, death by diabetes kind of way) and the mixed berry (it's just a glorified muffin for pete's sake).

I like the fact that they have mini cupcakes, but they're usually in the predictable flavors: red velvet, chocolate, etc. I wish they had minis in all flavors, so I could sin a little more and feel a little less guilty.

Long story short, Molly's is top notch. Go there now.

I'm a fan of Molly's place. Their molly red velvet cupcake with cream chesse topping is the best. I also recommend raspberry green hot tea...so gooddd..
i pick this place as my fav after meal.

While the cupcakes were ok I wasn't totally blown away.  Unfortunately, the pumpkin cupcake that I had was a bit on the dry side.  However, the plain vanilla cupcake was pretty good.  

The most disappointing part about coming here was the lack of selection.  Hmm, let me clarify... the availability was the issue.  You see the signage advertising some fantastic sounding cupcakes but a lot of what we wanted was gone or not ready.  We were there early on a Sunday morning so I was surprised that they had almost no mini cupcakes at all and there was absolutely no red velvet to be had anywhere.  Either most of what we tried to get was reservederved" for people that had called in orders or they had just come out of the oven and were too hot for icing still.  Boo.  :(  I want to chalk this up to just bad luck on the timing.  I may give it another whirl at some point but I'm in no hurry to try again.

(Generic comment gushing over the amazingness of Molly's)

I'm going to try my hardest NOT to compare Molly's to Magnolia.  Not because I don't want to, but because it would be impossible to compare them without having one of each at the same time, and until I earn enough to fly out to NYC solely for a cupcake, I'm kind of SOL.  Suffice to say, I move that Molly's should be considered the greatest cupcake outside of NYC.

Like probably too many people, I'd heard about Molly's from Ron & Fez (Hey buddies), but never got around to going there because my memory, even cupcake-related is terrible whenever I find myself in the area.   Clearly, the only choice for me was the Ron Bennington cupcake, which is less of a cupcake and more of an orgasm in a cupcake wrapper.  The tiramisu was great too, as far as I could tell from the one bite I managed to steal.  I would say the coffee is a must too, because it's pretty good, and the only way to make it out of Molly's without slipping into a sugar coma.

I LOVED the whole appearance of this place, it was like being 8 again.  From the awesome selection of board games to the swing seats, it made an otherwise mediocre day a great one.

We ordered a dozen for a bachelorette party. Got the Bennington, red velvet, chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry. The red velvet smelled and tasted like medicine, we didn't even bother to finish the red velvet cupcakes. The other cupcakes were "ordinary". Not impressed.

Another four star review from yours truly.  I love the "make your own cupcake" idea.   My favorite is the RED VELVET cupcake.  Evidently you either love it or you hate it.... and I love it!  The cake is moist, and the frosting is very cheesy and kinda tart.   I like tart things... and they like me.

As for the other cupcakes, they are pretty good too.  However given the choice, I like other cupcake establishments better (Mandy B's, Swirlz).  BUT, if I wanted red velvet........  would I go to swirlz?  Nay.  Would I go to Mandy B's?  Nay..... I would go go Molly's.  Yay!

I flippin' love buttercream frosting.  I have tried, somewhat successfully, to re-create my own delicious version at home and was becoming quite pleased with myself.  And then Molly's put me to shame.   The perfectly moist carrot-cake cupcake, so full of flavor and a hint of spice, nearly melted in my mouth on its own, but it was the frosting that put it over the top.  Delicious!!!  

I will definitely be back when I have some time to kill, because the interior is too cute NOT to spend a bit of leisurely time in.  You have to love the fact that the founder named this place after his third grade teacher who used to bake her students cupcakes when it was their birthday; it just doesn't get much more warm and fuzzy than that.  Unless of course you add in the cute seats at the coffee bar that double as swings (genius),  a "sprinkle station" to decorate your frosting (whimsical), and a counter full of mini cupcakes in case you're having a 100-calorie-pack kind of day (practical).   You can't lose!!

Fresh, and different and Delicious all come to mind when you come to this place.

It feels so friendly as you sit on a swing, indulging in a cupcake creation, a cup of joe, and a challenging game of Jenga with friends.

These cupcakes aren't your everyday kind, some are stuffed gooey sweet fillings like lemon, or chocolate. If their pre-made cakes aren't exactly what you were craving, you can even build your own choosing from a bunch of cake flavors, frostings and even fillings.

Its a lovely place to hang out and catch up with friends, and add some delicious calories to that salad diet you are on for swim suit season.

I think this may be my favorite cupcake place in all of Chicago!  Good size cupcake, always moist cake, frosting isn't heavy. Try a chocolate cupcake with chocolate frosting...amazing!  I also really loved their blueberry cheesecake, and I'm not one for blueberries.  Can't wait for my next visit!

WOW!! The cupcake I enjoyed at Molly's on Sunday was basically a religous carb experience. The case was packed with delicious looking little treats- all perky swirls of colors, fruit, chocolate and sprinkles, but I was a gal on a mission: straight up Red Velvet or Bust.
I ordered my little c-cake, and the girl at the counter responded, "Oh- our Red Velvet just got voted Best in the City!" and I was in. I can't even completely tell you what happened over the following next few minutes, but it involved a lot of contented sighs and a single bite I begrudgingly shared with my BF. Just trust me: try one of these. They are heaven!!!

I love cupcakes. Let me say that again, I love cupcakes.

I like Molly's desserts.  If you want to get cupcakes here, go for the center filled variety. The normal cupcakes are above average and light. Some of the other cupcake places are heavy like a piece of cake. What I also did try was the cheesecake and the brownie.  I loved both of them because they are both simpler taste that is more refined. The cheescake was smooth and just the right consistency.  The brownie had a small essence of fudge in it so it went down smoothly and quick.

I like that Molly's is open late and the staff is very friendly. I will come back for center filled cupcakes and for the other desserts.

So of all the bakeries and cupcake places I have been to...this one is BY FAR the best for cupcakes!  The frosting...not to sickeningly sweet...and the cake...SUPER moist and delicious!!  I tried the chocolate with butter cream, red velvet with cream cheese and the white with butter cream.  My favorite of the three was the chocolate with butter cream!  It was just SO good...reminded me of my own...which, of course, I am partial to. =]

FYI...I got to try Molly's because my sister-in-law ordered them for my other sister-in-law's college graduation party...so that is why there was such a big assortment to choose from.  =]  

I will definitely be going back!

i'm just going to say it...best cherry cheesecake i've had...i only wish i had taken a photo!

i'm dying to try their french silk chocolate pie!

I usually do not like frosting at all. Not at Molly's. The filled cupcakes topped with a variety of frostings are to die for. The Peach Cobbler and Pumpkin (seasonal) filled are amazing. Yes, they are a tad pricey but worth it. Plus, the decor inside is super cute. If I have enough room for dessert after dinner at one of the many restaurants on Clark, Molly's is a must.

Reasons to love Molly's:

They're open until midnight on the weekend (not sure about hours during the week).

Lemon cupcake with lemon curd filling (the candied lemon peel on top makes it over the top awesome).  Now that I've had it, I can't bring myself to order anything else.

They do a pretty mean chocolate cupcake too.

The people behind the counter are nice.

They serve Intelligentsia coffee.  Yum.

Cute place with the best vanilla cupcakes that I've ever had.  Sometimes there are too many kids in there for my taste.  I hate kids and I'm a troll, what can I say.  Until this town gets the childless cupcakery that it deserves, Molly's is on top.  

So much frosting.  Amazing.

The reviews for Molly's aren't as good as they should be.  I think Molly's is so cute and the concept is great.  Everything in there is from a school and they even donate some of their proceeds.  They have such a variety of cupcakes and you can make your own upon arrival.  Different cakes, different frostings, different fillings and different toppings.  You choose and and they'll make it for you right there.  None of the "we only have chocolate or vanilla".  The Red velvet cupcake is so good and the vanilla cupcake with brown butter is my favorite.  Can't forget to mention the sprinkle station they have to decorate your own cupcakes!

My favorite thing about Molly's has to be the swings that are at the bar.  Granted they are attached at the bottom so you can't really swing, but so cute.  

Yes, maybe they have a few kinks to work out, but every place is like that when they first open.  Service is just a little slow, but I'm sure it'll get better, and definitely won't stop me from returning.  Molly's is a great addition to Clark street and I promise I'll be back.   It doesn't hurt that they are around the corner from my house!

The two women behind the counter barely acknowledged my presence as they were busy w/ a mob of ladies complementing the adorable decor (yet purchasing no cupcakes).

My $4 cupcake was definitely at least worth $3, I had the Key Lime and really enjoyed it.
The only thing I can say is...Holy Cow dems some wonderful cups cakes!

OMG. Yes, these cupcakes have reduced me to text-isms. But seriously, OMG these cupcakes rock. They rock enough to overlook that I could buy a box of Duncan Hines and make about 40 of them for the price of one of these.

I think there is crack in the frosting on the red velvet cupcake, because there's no other explanation for the immediate high it creates. We also had the lemon cupcake, and the cream in the middle was lemony heaven...

Run, don't walk, to Molly's cupcakes. And stop by my house on the way home.

YUMMY! The cupcakes here are delicious, moist, and just the right amount of sweetness.  I tried the red velvet cupcake and I have to admit that it definitely ranks up there with some of the tastiest cupcakes I've enjoyed.  I especially like the fact that the cupcakes aren't as expensive as what I'm used to in LA.  The regular flavored cupcakes are $2 and the premium cupcakes go for $3.50. I will be coming back soon to try those mini personal cakes of love.

The store is actually really big inside and super cute.  The swings at the counter are adorable.  The decor inside is very nostalgic, dainty, and girly.  The whole story behind the name is sweet too, named after the owner's 3rd grade teacher.  There are tons of other sweet treats to try, such as cookies, cakes, ice cream, and pies.  They also serve a wide variety of coffee drinks to go with your dessert.  

I'll be coming back to Molly's Cupcakes soon to take family and friends for some sweet indulgence.

Now THIS place is FUN!

Molly's has a lot of unique and fun filled cupcakes that make this experience exciting! The store itself is really cute, and it's fun to stare at the glass case full of options. They also have cards that describe their cupcakes, which is helpful for the customer. This does not stop me from engaging the counter attendant, who actually appears to be knowledgeable about the recipe and baking of the cupcake. The staff all seem very enthused about each of the cupcakes and it makes the experience more exciting.

It is also evident that the cupcakes are baked fresh in this store. I have been here several times, and every cupcake I have had is delicious and is the perfect amount of moistness - my favorite is the Ron Bennington. I'm definitely a fan!

Like everyone else has said, this place is adorable. I wandered in one freezing cold night to pick up a few cupcakes about a half hour before they were closing.

I selected one Mint Velvet and one Cookies & Cream cupcakes. Both were delicious, but the C&C was a bit too chocolaty for me (the cupcake itself reminded me of a Little Debbie). The Mint Velvet was wonderful!

The cupcakes were a bit pricey ($3.75/piece) for the filled variety. The other varieties seem to be significantly cheaper.

The employees were incredibly chipper and friendly, even after one mentioned that he had been working for 11 hours. But I think being in that colorful place, surrounded by cupcakes, you are automatically happy all the time.

They could work on their packaging. So far, More and Swirlz win in that department because their boxes have little holes to hold the cupcakes in place. Molly's didn't, and by the time I got home my cupcakes had been jostled around quite a bit (blame that on my driving) and there was more frosting on the box than the cupcakes. But don't think I didn't lick it off...

This is my favorite cupcake place in the city. Other than the fact I've only been here and More, that might not be saying much, but I still love this place.

First, these cupcakes are normal. Normal in the sense that they don't have some strange ingredient(bacon cupcakes come to mind). You got chocolate, peanut butter, velvet, mint, gnutella, cream, etc. Its how they combine these normal ingredients that make this place so good.

My favorite is the Ron Bennington, peanut butter center, butterscotch, chocolate! This is in their specialty cupcakes that have a center filled with something.

Just a heads up, expect to spend about $4 a cupcake for the cream filled ones. Thinking about it, this is quite pricey because this is the price of a meal at some fast food joints, but i keep finding myself coming back here when i'm craving something sweet and tasty.
Interior is cool but my red velvet cupcakes was only mediocre.

I used to go out of my way to go to Molly's cupcakes to pick up the Peanut Butter Nutella cupcake.  I recently went there to pick up a few PB Nutella cakes only to find out that they are no longer available.  Why would you take your best item off the menu?  I heard some silly rumor that the Nutella was too expensive and they were losing money on that particular menu item.  I find it hard to believe that they are losing money on a $4 cupcake, but if that is the case then raise the price on this cupcake.  If they are going to continue to not carry this menu item, then they at least need to make the recipe public.  I now have no reason to make the trip to Molly's cupcakes as I have several other cupcake shops closer to my home.  Please bring it back!!!!

i love this place! fresh cupcake! fresh toppings! yummy!!!

i love the fact that they close later too because most of the cupcake places close early!

it has such a nice ambiance too, might be crowded a lot of time because it is so popular!

I recently took a trip to Molly's when I was in Chicago visiting some friends.  Their cupcakes are delicious, easily the best cupcakes I've ever had. I tried a few different ones; the Ron Bennington (chocolate peanut butter) and the s'mores were my two favorites. In particular, I can't stress enough how great the Ron Bennington cupcake is. The peanut butter filling is fantastic. I brought a few home with me and I'm sad now that they're all gone.

Also, the service was great and everyone was friendly, especially the owner Mike. He securely packed a bunch of cupcakes for me so they'd survive my trip home. The decor is bright and airy and welcoming, which goes well with the friendly service and delicious cupcakes.

If you're in Chicago, you owe it to yourself to go to Molly's and get yourself some. I wish there was one in Philly.

Ladies and gentlemen, I believe we have a winner.

We have been trying to find cupcakes for our wedding instead of the regular cake.  Honestly, I've been seriously underwhelmed (and the fiance has been super picky) with the previous places.

First off, the decoration of the place is awesome.  So comfortable and welcoming.  The staff was friendly even though the place was PACKED (it was a warm, sunny Saturday afternoon).

The cupcakes were moist, flavorful and the perfect size.  I had a lemon filled one which was just heaven.  More importantly, the ridiculously picky fiance loved his carrot cake cupcake so much he wouldn't share.  Also the pick-your-own frosting and such is a wonderful idea.  Oh yeah, and I've noticed that most places charge about $3 per cupcake, but Molly's are only $2.  Woo hoo!

Thank goodness, I was about to give up hope.

Just love this place. I was so over the cupcake thing due to the focus on novelty over flavor. This place actually about how their product tastes! So good that I came by 2 days in a row for the chocolate cupcake filled with peanut butter and topped w/ crushed butterfingers (can't remember what it was called - you'll know the one I mean.) So GOOD!

I'm being generous here because honestly I think this place is highly overrated.  First and foremost, I know parking sucks in Chicago - but seriously...After driving around the block 3 times to attempt to find parking, I finally decided just to have my hubby sit in the car on the corner of a bus stop so that I could get these cupcakes.

Once I came in, it was a bit chaotic at the counter, things kinda sprawled everywhere, though there were only 2 clients in the store.  But I quickly overlooked that when I saw the cases full of cupcakes.  I couldn't make up my mind with flavors (there were quite a few, hence I the two stars) I bought one of each for our small office party to share.  I thought it would be nice since "it's from a place that was on Cupcake Wars", had a celebrity feel to them.  Seriously, that's all it was, celebrity.  They're expensive - though I could probably chalk that up to high downtown (Lincoln Park) storefront rent, they're dry, and sugary.  It's sad to me that I could say the Target cake I had a kid's birthday party over the weekend tasted better....

I really wanted to like this place.  Sorry Molly :(

Oh Molly's how I love you so. Why must you be so far away?

Since I am a huge fan of the Ron and Fez show on Sirius XM I have been hearing about Molly's since they opened 13 months ago. I honestly must say they were worth the wait, and definitely did not disappoint. I made 3 trips to Molly's during the 5 day trip I had there.

During the first visit I had to try the "Ron Bennington: I Have My Own Cupcake" named after Ron of the Ron and Fez show.  Before my girlfriend could even look up at me I had inhaled the cupcake. It was so good; I couldn't even wait in between bites. I just had to keep going because of how good it truly was. From this point forward I was hooked, I couldn't not keep going back.

Saturday night after Shabbat the first thing me and the girlfriend did was trek back down to Molly's. Who cares if it spoiled our appetites for dinner right? On this occasion I tried the Cookie Monster cupcake. On top of the cupcake in the frosting was a delicious little cookie, baked to perfection. Much to my surprise as I downed this cupcake, there actually was cookie dough inside the cupcake. It was such a pleasant surprise and I was in love again.

Sunday after doing dinner at Wildfire we couldn't help but stop back off at Molly's. We had steak for dinner so do to religious purposes we were unable to have dairy. Thankfully we had checked out their website before heading to Chicago so we knew they carried vegan cupcakes. They only kind they had were vanilla cake with chocolate frosting and once again I was not disappointed. Who knew something vegan could be so good? Since it was a cold rainy night we decided not to go out and really do anything else. Instead we grabbed the Connect Four game from the corner and played for about a half hour.

While there the girlfriend spotted a cinnamon roll cupcake as well that she was so tempted to try. Since we couldn't have the dairy she decided to get it to go. The next morning when we awoke she quickly ran over to grab the cupcake. Before I even grabbed for my glasses pieces of the cupcake were being fed to me (how could I complain about that right?). Much to our surprise this wasn't just a cinnamon cupcake it really was like a cinnamon roll, and peeled off in pieces. I was yet again blown away by Molly's.

If you are going to Chicago this place is a must no matter what. I will be dreaming about these cupcakes for weeks.

I stopped in today to satisfy my sweet tooth's official addiction.  The owner and the rest of the staff were likely cracking up at how I am a one woman PR crew for this business.  However, there is actually a purpose for the new review: the new vanilla truffle cupcake.  I'm not sure I can do this justice but I'll try.  An upside down super moist vanilla cupcake with raspberry filling, chocolate truffle icing, and then dipped in hard chocolate to really make this a 5-star confection.  The blend of flavors is divine and will now rival the Ron Barrington as my favorite treat this in all local place.  Plus, the espresso and coffee drinks are made with true integrity that would completely show up the Starbucks of the world.  

Hooray for Mollys!!!  

I heart you!!
This spot is A-Ok for cupcakes! I've been to the locations both in Chicago and NYC, creative flavor combinations and always a vegan option..a good spot to curb those cupcake cravings.

Heaven in a cupcake....seriously.

The atmosphere in the shop is adorable too. The founder themed and named Molly's after his third grade teacher who would bake delicious cupcakes for everyone's birthday. They have pretty late hours, and it amazing that it's even packed until 10 p.m. weeknights. I think people enjoy just hanging out in there too because there are cute little classroom-themed tables/chairs, swings at the counter, and even board games! Oh, and a 'sprinkle station' (super cute). It's one of the places you walk in and you want to own a place like that yourself!

Unfortunately I walk past Molly's when going most places since it's so close to my house. I'm beginning to get to the point of not being able to walk by at all without stopping in and satisfying my sweet tooth! Usually when I make dinner my boyfriend will stop and get two Molly's cupcakes for us and when he makes dinner I'll stop and get cupcakes on the way to his place, so it's beginning to be expected now from both of us!

His favorite: The Red Velvet (he gets that every time)
My favorites: Cookies-n-Cream, Tiramisu, Blueberry Cheesecake (all of these are center-filled, hence the 'heaven in a cupake' part!)

What a cute place!  Who could ask for anything more?  Yummy cupcakes and ice cream, swings, intelligentsia coffee, and games in an old-fashioned ice cream parlor atmosphere!    AND they have games you can play while you are eatin/visiting.  I had the yellow cake cupcake with lemon curd center and buttercream frosting.  Really good....  perfectly tart and sweet.  

Try the strawberry shortcake cupcake....  how good is a real strawbeery inside a white cupcake with reall cream frosting?!

Highly recommend a visit PLUS it would be a wonderful little date spot... if you want to make a great impression on us women, this is a perfect way to do it for a lower price!

All I can say is I moaned thru every bite. I tried the peach cobbler, the blueberry cheese cake and the decadent chocolate. I didn't care for the frosting on the peach cobbler but outside of that they were wonderful!

As if this place needs anymore reviews but here's my 2 cents. Delicious! The flavor combinations were good and unique. We ordered a few and don't remember their names, but 2 of them were peanut butter + nutella, which was my favorite! It said on the sign that it was their best seller and I can see why. Definitely one of the best-flavored cupcakes I've had. Why the 4 stars? I just didn't think that the cake itself was fluffy. If you've had Sprinkles cupcakes, you know how light and airy their cupcakes are and these don't compare. I'll try their other cupcakes, maybe the peanut butter made the batter heavier? I still love this place!
Get the Ron Bennington! I also got a half dozen of regular cupcakes and each was better than the last! This place was the best! I was just disappointed I didn't get to try on the $3000 sunglasses.

Ahhhh whipped frosting!  My nemesis.  I got a cookie monster and everything was good except the frosting which tasted like RediWhip.  The hubby got a peanut butter nutella and he said the frosting was meh but the cupcake portion was really good and it tasted like a great peanut butter cookie.  We both got a chocolate decadence and it was amazing.  For some reason he didn't eat the bottom of the cupcake, I think he said it was dry but I didn't have that problem with mine.  We likely wouldn't go back unless we were in the neighborhood and they had chocolate decadence on hand.

Oh Ron Bennington, how I love thee.  The cupcakes here are yummy, and every so often they'll come out with a new flavor.  They are pretty sweet though, as most of the cupcakes are filled.  If you're looking for a regular cupcake topped with icing, you're not going to get it here.  The Ron Bennington, one of their most popular, is a chocolate cupcake injected with a peanut butter center, topped with chocolate icing and some crunchy peanut butter candy bits.  There are very few flavors that aren't injected, so these are really more like full dessert experiences rather than mere cupcakes.

For those who complain that it's too sweet... it's a specialty cupcake shop, what do you expect?  The cupcakes are supposed to be overly indulgent and over the top.  If you want a plain cupcake with icing slapped on top of it, go to the grocery store and buy the six packs.

I drive from the suburbs all the way to Molly's so that must tell you something. The cupcakes are delish. The staff is super friendly & fun. Atmosphere is great except I wish there was a little more room for seating because it tends to get a little crowded in there. I highly recommend you come to Molly's and enjoy some fabulous cupcakes!

a 6-month average of 4 stars and 185 reviews.  What the hell else can be said of this place.

The Ron Bennington is the best damn cupcake ever made on the face of the Earth.  It's worth every penny.  I'm a butterscotch/peanutbutter/chocoholic and this is the perfect marriage of them both.  Seriously, my wife saw this one and basically said "Go ahead and buy 2 of them so you have one to take home"  

To Dave H, get XM Satellite radio and turn on channel 202 from 11-2 each day. (Ron/Fez 12-3)  That's the Ron Bennington.

I live in the far western suburbs (so far I don't know if you can call them the suburbs anymore) and it's worth the ride/stop when I'm downtown for Cub games!  I'm sure I'll be there during the playoffs (every game!)

Let me start by saying that the cupcakes here are quite delicious.  This is a dense cupcake with not-too-sweet icing and a creative concept - right up my alley.  Molly's has a great variety and that's what makes it a solid joint.  This review is not a 4-5 star review because it suffered from customer service.  

Know the following: 1) I am a foodie, and I will go out of my way to get tasty treats at any time at any place that's willing to indulge me.  2) I am a nerd, so I will do my due diligence on an establishment and its product online before I step foot into it.  3) I do not live in or around Lincoln Park.  What does this all mean?  It means that when I want a cupcake at 11pm, I look online for the hours of a late-night joint, I phone first, and I expect it to be open when I get there after driving in my pajamas for over 20 minutes.  

If you expect to visit Molly's on a Saturday night (a night they post operating hours till midnight), arrive by 11pm.  On three occasions this year, I have come to Molly's to find it closed well before midnight.  Burned gas + no cupcake = angry lady .  If you close at midnight it could mean one of two things: 1) you stop serving ~30 mins before closing and actually lock your doors at midnight or 2) you concurrently stop serving AND lock your doors at midnight.  The problem is that when I arrived, it seemed as though they exercised #2 at 11:30pm.   Which kind of defeats the purpose of posting hours till midnight online. o_O???  So, yeah....beware.

Molly's cupcakes need to be refrigerated/frozen if they're not being served right away.  This is perfectly fine - I get that, especially since much of their icing is whipped creme-based.  The second part of my review involves a rude-ish employee and this piece of information.  

Me:  I'd like to order a dozen (proceeds with order)
Her: Are these all for you? (innocent enough question...possibly :-/)
Me:  Don't know...I'll likely eat one or two, share some with the fam, and pick off of them the rest of the week. Two Peach Cobbler, Two Ron Bennington...
Her: You're just gonna leave'em out?
Me: Uhhhh...
Her: Caaaauuse ya can't just leave'em out...(the volume of her voice raising)
Me: So you're saying I'd have to refrigerate them, right? (caaause, I've had your cupcakes before)
Her: Yeah caaaause the icing will melt...they have to refrigerated if they're gonna last a week. (said in a "you idiot" tone of voice and facial expression as she seemed to hold up the order until I verbalized my comprehension of her statement)
Me: That's fine...One cookie monster, two peanut butter nutella... (she's still looking at me while loading the cupcakes....weirdo)
Her: What were the last two again?
Me: o_O (had you not been such a cupcake nazi, you would've heard me)

The fact that there was a line behind me made the situation awkward.  Furthermore, she could've eliminated at least six lines of communication by just stating off the top (as she filled my order as requested) "Just to let you know, we recommend refrigerating our cupcakes if you're going to have them over *___ amount of time* to ensure the freshness of the whipped topping".  OR Molly's could just print this on their boxes and/or post it in their establishment (if not already done).  The tudey rigmarole was an unnecessary turnoff and it delayed my and other's orders.  

This may not seem like a big deal to some, but I'm a stickler for customer service and efficiency.  Don't be inefficient DUE to poor service...that costs you two stars.
Great cupcakes and terrific service.

This place is DANGEROUSLY close to my house!!

I LOVE their cupcakes!

I've tried a few of the specialty cupcakes and they were alright, but their standard cupcakes are wonderful!

I stick to Red Velvet and Carrot Cake, they are my absolute favorite.

The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is:

They tend to run out of both of these flavors in the evening, AND they pile the frosting really high so the cupcakes are top heavy. When you have a few in one box, they tend to fall over onto each other. It can get pretty messy.

But they still taste good :)

Molly... I think I love you... Well I love your red velvet cupcakes at least! Delicious. I have walked past this place a couple dozen times, thinking "hmmm how can a cupcake business survive in LP??" Then last week, I had some friends in town who enjoy eating A LOT. We walked by after having lunch down the street, and they suggested dessert. Mmmmmmmmmmmmmm is all I could say about the moist goodness that followed and the perfect cream cheese frosting on my $2 cupcake. Sooo good. I will actually have to avoid this place before my rear turns into a cupcake.

PS They have a vegan double chocolate cupcake, which my friend had to eat in two sittings because it was so rich.
Atmosphere is fun!  Servers were dancing.  Felt like I was in a music video.

I. love. this. place!

I am a huge fan of cupcakes, so when I found out about this place, I couldn't wait to try it. Once I did, I've been telling everyone to go there.

The cupcakes are delicious--very moist, excellent frosting, and unique flavors (love the filled ones--strawberry shortcake, key lime, tiramisu). Every time I've gone, my group has ordered several different flavors and split them between everyone, which is a great way to try a bunch. I haven't tried their other stuff (I think they have ice cream? And other bakery goods?) but coffee and cupcakes is amazing.

Beyond the cupcakes themselves, the atmosphere and decor of the place is excellent. It's bright and airy and fun. They have sweet swing chairs at the coffee bar, and plenty of other tables scattered throughout--plus, games! I don't know what it is, but any bar/ice cream shop/bakery that includes piles of games for customers to enjoy is good in my book.

Run, don't walk, to Molly's. You won't regret it.

I love their specialty cupcakes - the strawberry shortcake is addicting.  Their key lime one is really good and I forgot the name, but it had chocolate and peanut butter...mmm so good.

I am slightly disappointed about their regular cupcakes (basic vanilla or chocolate)...I've had them twice and both were dry.

The store is super cute though...I love the swings at the bars!

My daughter and I are on a mission to try all the Cupcake Wars winners, Molly's was next on our list. It was incredibly crowded on a Saturday afternoon. The decor is fun, the staff seemed annoyed, and the cupcakes were not bad.  Not fabulous either, but pretty good.  We tried the Chicago Fire, peanut butter nutella, Ron , and Kahlua.  The Chicago Fire was not good.  It was average to slightly-below.  The Kahlua was tasty, though not a stand out. The Ron Barrington was delicious, as was the peanut butter nutella.
Glad to check Molly's off our list, but don't feel like we need to go back.

My sweet tooth is as big as a sweet tooth can be, and Molly's does well to satisfy it. The shop has many different types of cupcakes, including many seasonal offerings. The last time I was there, they had some sort of pumpkin-based concoction. Molly's also has cupcake toppings one would never fathom, such as Nutella. If you don't like Nutella or pumpkins, Molly's lets you build your own cupcake.

I, however, have only one, true mistress. She is dark and mysterious. You may know her as chocolate, and I come to Molly's for my cacao fix. The brownies are chewy, tender, and delicious. If you are lucky enough to get a chocolate chip cookie right out of the oven, its warmth and gooeyness will cure the most melancholy of days.

Unfortunately, Molly's runs out of cookies and brownies sometimes. This can be frustrating, but any chocoholic will find the Chocolate Decadence cupcake to be a worthy substitute.

The staff is friendly and authentic, and the owners are often behind the counter. If there is a crowd, the waiting time for service can be oppressive. But that is a minor annoyance in what is otherwise a delightful experience.

Molly's has been in the neighborhood for about a year now - here's hoping to many more, filled with chocolate, vanilla, and even Nutella.

I have to say I've never been a big fan of dessert, but this place is pretty damn good.  I tried the red velvet, chocolate, and vanilla so far.  I've been hearing about the cookie monster and that boston cream looked good too.  Best cupcakes I've had in chicago.  Possibly compares to Magnolia in NYC.... possibly...

I was eagerly anticipating the opening of Molly's Cupcakes. I am an avid baker and was very excited for the prospect of a good bakery within walking distance of my house. Unfortunately, I will still have to make the trek to Sweet Mandy B's.

I purchased 2 cupcakes, one Red Velvet (already made) and a make your own, chocolate with french buttercream and an oatmeal raisin cookie to go.

On taste, the Red Velvet cupcakes was hard as a rock on the outside, not sure if it was burnt or sitting out all day. The most upsetting thing about this is that the girl who put the cupcake into the container to go had to have known that it was hard, and she had no problem selling me a hard inedible cupcake.

The chocolate cupcake was soft and moist, but the buttercream was awful. It tasted like I was eating a slab of butter on top of my cupcake. Being someone who bakes regularly, it was obviously missing the right amount of sugar.

The decor of the place is different, school themed with really cute swings at the coffee bar. They do announce when you walk in that they have only been open less then 10 days but there was nothing in the cases, which made you wonder if they were ready to be open for customers. There were also 4 women behind the counter taking orders, which seemed like 2 too many.

They frost the cupcakes right there when you order a make your own, but I would have to say the girl who frosted mine was no Martha Stewart. She messily smeared on way too much buttercream with a spatula that was full of tiny bits of cake, and who knows what else.

They have what would be good to-go containers if their cupcakes were a little bigger, but because they are pretty small, they slop around and by the time I got home with them, they looked even more messy then when we left. The table behind the counter was also messy looking and looked like it had not been cleaned up since they opened.

All in all, my experience at Molly's was pretty awful. I would not recommend this place to anyone. I would say that I do wish them luck, as it is definitely a a nice thing to have in the neighborhood, but I doubt they will be around for very long.  They have quite a ways to go and many improvements to make before I even consider coming back in.

Went here with one of the TOP cupcake tasters in the US. My son! he's 5, and we went to pick up some cupcakes for his Bday. After trying just about everything in town from Sweet Mandy B's, to Sprinkles, and everything in-between. I do say, the price isn't as high as the Sprinkles of the world, and the types of flavors, or types of cupcakes is broader then Sweet Mandy B's, as they only have white or dark cake with different color frosting. Mollys though, hit the flavor or types on the head! I had the nuetella banana one, and it might have been the best cupcake I ever had. My son, had a red-velvet, and loved it.. Again, he's the final word.. Plus, the place had some cool swings, but they were bolted into the floor. Would certainly go back and try some of the other flavors..

After eating some of these cupcakes all over the city, I'm still waiting for someone to do a lighter, maybe not so heavy cupcake. One that after you eat it, where you don't feel like you've eaten for a football team..

I took my cousins to Mollys for a fun neighborhood experience, loved the scene, great place to grab a tea and play a board game, but the cupcakes are significantly overpriced for their lack in taste.  My jaw almost dropped when I was charged $25 for 6 medium-sized cupcakes.  

The 4 of us shared the cupcakes, we got the peach cobbler, Ron something-or-other, Boston cream, cookies n cream and 2 of the immensely chocolaty ones.  Our favorite was the peach cobbler but we all agreed that none of them were that impressive - maybe we went on a bad day but definitely nothing worth writing home about.

If you are looking for cupcake suggestions might I suggest Phoebe's Cupcakes up on Broadway, cupcakes are about the same size but a good deal cheaper and much tastier OR Crumbs (I think they have multiple Chicago locations) it's a bit pricier but these are monster size cupcakes and they are DELICIOUS!

This place is awesome!  Best red velvet cupcakes I've EVER had...and I've had a lot of them!  Honestly I think this place is much better than Sweet Mandy B's - although SMBs has great desserts aside from their cupcakes.  Molly's is usually packed and they try to get you through quickly.  I will also note that they are "good people" as they have donated to the my charity on two separate occasions.  Great cupcakes, great company.  Two thumbs up!

I went here for the first time on a birthday dessert crawl for a friend of mine.  I wanted to try them all.  I really liked this chocolate/raspberry one.  It was a mouth full of flavor and gooey yumminess.  The cake was moist, and the flavors were great.  I recommend going with friends and trying lots of them.

I'm a Teacher so the whole story about Molly, the first grade teacher that inspired the store, got me. But dood, I can't afford the cupcakes on my salary!!

That said, the red velvet  cupcakes are the best I've tasted and worth the splurge. Since moving to NYC, I've been on the hunt for decent red velvet ANYTHING, and have been utterly disappointed. Billy's, Magnolia...so much hype for dry cupcakes. And don't get me started on cake. So kudos to Molly's for giving me another reason to come home.

If y're a fan of dessert first, then sign up for a table at Toro Sushi, then chill out at Molly's until y're called. Molly's decor is a bit much for me (my friends & I were afraid the swings would collapse, an irrational fear, I know; I teach all day, so a playroom filled with kids and regressing adults feels like being back at work). But the games will make the time fly, and I have no problem going from the best cupcakes to the best Sushi in town (and back again)!

I took a few red velvet cupcakes back with me to NYC. If I pretend the cupcakes were bought in NYC, I can justify the price. All too easy enough.

I was ecstatic to learn of a new cupcake shop.  However, I was disappointed with the cake consistency, the frosting was almost hard and the price was high.  I agree with the other reviews about the shop and its decor.   It is whimsical.  But I want good cupcakes too!!  Maybe I will give them another chance.

On a second visit for a taste test of cupcakes I ordered a basic cupcake and got the light, french vanilla butter cream frosting.  It tasted like whip cream.  Do not get this frosting unless you like whip cream on your cupcakes.  I did not even finish the cake.

This place is a totally hit!  The decor is fabulous... the swings in place of bar stools pure GENIUS (don't worry they were chained down).  To the crazy bathrooms that took you back to grammar school.  Their to go boxes are even festive.  If you decide to take a site they had a ton of games for everyone to play from connect four to my personal favorite scrabble.

Now with the cupcakes I was so excited this place had vegan cupcakes - you do not find to many places that have them.  Sadly enough that day they were all out of soy and almond milk.  But I did have their green rose tea (I think .. green tea with pink things in it) excellent alternative.  If you are in the area you must stop in.

Best cupcakes in the country.  I've tried cupcakes in multiple cities, chains and small places, and Molly's from my hometown of Chicago beats them all.  I go in for cupcakes every time I'm back in town.

I'm happy I live nowhere near this place.  If I did, I'd probably be about 10 pounds heavier.

I came here with about 5 or 6 other girls for a friend's birthday on a Sunday afternoon.  There was enough seating for us all to sit together, and play Boggle if we so chose.  They also have swings at the bar counter, which I probably would have sat in, had there been less of us.  Also, whatever mix CD or ipod shuffle they were playing there was AWESOME.

There's a nice variety there- a lot of chocolate cupcakes, some vanilla, red velvet, or you can create your own.  There's not many other desserts there other than cupcakes, but really, I can't imagine anything being much better.  I got a cookie cupcake with vanilla frosting on top and cookie dough in the middle.  I'm pretty sure that we all learned eating raw cookie dough is bad for you, but I would have happily suffered a brief bout of salmonella for my 15 minutes of heaven devouring that cupcake.

Molly's knows how to do cupcakes.  It was love at first sight when I walked in and saw the sprinkle station with every sort of sprinkle you and your cupcake delighting heart could ever want.  To add to the fun are several swings that serve as seats.  When it comes to the cupcakes you can pick out one of the already created favorites or create your own.  

I had two...first amazing cake in a cup: chocolate cake with chocolate ganache, peanut butter, and topped with crushed butterscotch bits...second: yellow cake, crushed strawberries, buttercream frosting, and fresh strawberry.  

If you like cupcakes, you will like Molly's.
So good if you  like nutella and peanut  butter or peach cobbler you should try these

any cupcake with the buttercream frosting is worth trying.  
the peanut butter with the nutella filling was delicious but the peanut butter cake was a bit too greasy.  
i thought the cream cheese frosting on the red velvet was way too sweet and grainy.

not the best cupcakes ive tasted, but still glad i tried it.

going to molly's always seems like a good idea: fun flavors to choose from, a sprinkle station and adult-sized swings to sit on (weeeee!) -- but more often than not, i leave molly's with the sinking feeling of buyer's remorse. for me, the flavors don't live up to the hype. and $15 for four cupcakes? i'll say it again - $15 for four cupcakes?? i seem to forget that part every time... that is, until i get to the register.

i've tried almost all of the center-filled flavors molly's has to offer, and i can't say any of them have wowed me... but maybe i'm just not a center-filled kinda gal. call me a cupcake traditionalist, but i think molly's best is her classic.

needless to say, i know my naive-self will be back to molly's soon, searching for a cupcake to fall in love with.

ps - buyer beware: if you order the ron bennington: make sure you have some milk on hand. this cupcake is chock full of peanut butter and is guaranteed to glue your mouth shut in 2.2 seconds!

yummmmms.
this place is as good as it gets. the boston creme cupcake was delicious. my boyfriend tried the cookie monster cupcake which was also to die for. we loved the atmosphere and how they incorporated swing seats and board games :) very cute and cozy feel while affordable. great place to just sit and chat while watching the world go by.

The server was super nice and the cookie we got was amazing!  My friend ordered a red velvet cupcake and it was OK, but I'm convinced that I'd love the strawberry shortcake cupcake.  This half block of Clark has some of the best restaurants in Chicago!

Over six hundred reviews?!  I believe it.
